review: Dear Guest,  Thank you ever so much for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to read that you enjoyed your time with us, and had a silent night's sleep- our triple glazing really does reduce the external sound. We shall also pass on your comments about our friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really focus on customer service.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel, and we would love to see you again in the future. Please contact us directly at reception should you return to Dublin and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount. Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Very good and sweet hotel in the heart of dublin.
review: The hotel we fonund to be really nice with very friendly and halpful staff. The room was clean and tidy with free toiletries in the room. The localtion is just about perfect which is a short 5-10 mins walk to the Temple Bar area and O'connel Street areas. Breakfast was served in P Macs bar & restaurant which is attached to the hotel on the ground floor and the breakfast was fine at 9 Euros a person but it would have been nice to have some beans but overall it was fine.  Now the downside. We were on the top floor in room 503 which we were told was a quiet room even though we had all the windows shut we could hear the thump thump thump of music unti gone 02:30am. We got back in from an evening out around 11pm and the thump of the music we could hear coming up through the floor and…

title: Dublin city break
review: If there is a group of 6 of you planning a trip to Dublin for the weekend or longer you must stay here! I arranged a weekend trip with 5 friends for my birthday 15th august till the 17th. this is the 3rd time ive visited Dublin and I preferred staying here then any of the hotels. you cant check in until 3 but the helpful staff took all our bags and we went to the local super market which is 3 minute walk and did our shopping (full breakfast, tea bags and pizzas) the apartment is lovely and clean, and we soon got unpacked and ready for our night out. it was nice not to be told our music was to loud which you get constantly if your in a hotel! it was also nice to have all my friends just a door away rather then running down the corridor in a hotel. The staff at Drurys are amazing!…

title: lovely minmoon !!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your kind comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel in one of our apartments.  We are so delighted to read that you enjoyed your Birthday with us, and were able to make the most of the privacy and facilities offered in our apartments. We shall also pass on your lovely remarks about our friendly and helpful staff to the whole team here, as we really focus on our customer service. We have since ensured that the issue with the plug stopper has been rectified, so as not to inconvenience future guests- thank you for bringing this to our attention.  It would be a real pleasure to welcome you back in the future, please contact us directly at reception and we shall be delighted to offer you a return guest discount, as well as complimentary onsite parking. Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Good Central Location
review: We went to drury court hotel for a 3 day break after our wedding.We arrived early in the morning after a flight over and on arrival at the hotel mentioned we had just got married.The receptionist was lovely congratulated us and upgraded our room and said it was available immediately. We had a lovely big suite and were more than pleased with everything.The carpets were spotless and the room also , I have never know such a supply of hot water and water pressure that filled the bath in seconds. we loved staying here ! breakfast was great and the bar where it is served is very unusual with all odd furniture etc but added to the atmosphere, the hotel is ideally situated for all of the city just far enough away from temple bar but can get there in under 10 mins on foot no problem. on…

title: Fantastic central location
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel- it was a real delight to welcome you on your honeymoon to Dublin, and we are so glad to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. We shall certainly pass on your kind remarks about the cleanliness of the room and our friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really focus on our customer service.   Please do let us know directly at reception if you return to Dublin and we shall of course offer you a return guest discount off your next stay. We really hope to have the chance to welcome you back in the future. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Great central location
review: Knowing that I would be arriving early I contacted the hotel and they were only too happy to store my bags until the room was ready.  We arrived early and decided to use the hotel restaurant for breakfast (Dublin doesn't come alive early in Sundays so our choice was limited). The welcome from the staff was great and they went and booked us into our room so that the meal could be added to our stay.  According to my husband  The continental breakfast was very good. I decided to have the full Irish. This was disappointing, the sausages were very poor quality and the bacon could have been cooked longer and didn't have much taste. As our booking was room only we decided to eat elsewhere.  I cannot fault the room. It was clean, comfortable and spacious. I was anxious about noise at…

title: Fantastic apartment, will return!
review: I have just returned from staying at the Drury Court Hotel for 2 nights. As a party of 5 we booked to stay in the apartment block which joins onto the hotel. The apartment was lovely with 3 nicely decorated double rooms and a comfortable living area and kitchen.      The staff were extremely helpful and on-call 24 hours a day. On our second day the shower didn't appear to be heating up and the water pressure was low but a maintenance man was with us and the problem fixed within half an hour of us reporting the problem.     The apartment was self-catering and had all of the facilities needed to eat in and cook- however, being so close to Grafton Street and pubs and restaurants we didn't have much need for this (except for bacon sandwiches for breakfast!).    The location of the…

title: Nice central location
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely review of your recent stay in one of our apartments at the Drury Court Hotel. We have recently finished upgrading these, so are delighted that you found them well decorated and comfortable for your group. We are also glad to read that you made the most of your central location- we really are fortunate to be within walking distance of all of the sites and eateries that Dublin has to offer. We are sorry that there was an issue with the shower during your stay, but are happy that it was resolved quickly. We shall pass on your kind remarks about our helpful team to the whole team here, as we really focus on customer service.  Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Great base to see Dublin
review: My sister and I spent 3 nights at the Drury at the beginning of our Ireland adventure.  We felt this hotel was a good home base because of the location.  It was perfect!  Central, yet quiet.  Nothing fancy about it, but the staff was friendly and helpful, everything was clean and comfortable.

title: My Weekend Break
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to read that you were able to make the most of our central location- we really are fortunate to be so ideally located for seeing all that Dublin has to offer.  We are also delighted that you found our rooms comfortable, and shall pass on your kind remarks about our friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really focus on customer service. It was a real pleasure to welcome you to the Drury Court Hotel during your time in Dublin; please let us know if you are back in Dublin in the future and we shall be delighted to offer you a return guest discount. Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Great location great price
review: We stayed here for two nights as a base for a day in Dublin before we caught the ferry home.  It's a lovely hotel in a great location.  It's a family-run hotel and, unlike in some chains (even  big ones), the staff were fantastically helpful and irrepressibly cheerful at all times. The room, bed and bathroom were comfortable and clean. We didn't eat there in the evening but the breakfast was excellent. I'd recommend this hotel as a place to stay if you want to see Dublin and we will certainly use it again.

title: Worth a revisit!
review: Excellent hospitality and courteous staff. Special mention of Emma who ensured a late night booking for a on demand AC room.  Location of the hotel is central to Grafton Street and loads of options to eat and grab a pint.  Got a tastefully decorated room offering a quite peaceful sleep away from the buzz of the pubs on a busy road.   Worthy of a longer stay the next time around!!!

title: Nice, with great location
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. It was a real pleasure to welcome you and to be able to ensure you the air conditioned room for your stay with us.   We are glad to read that you were able to make the most of our central location, without being disturbed by any external noise during your stay- we are certainly fortunate that our triple glazing lessens this.  We would love to see you again in the future- please contact us directly at reception and we shall be delighted to offer you a return guest discount. Best,  Emma House

title: Girly night in Dublin
review: The Drury Court is ideally located for exploring the city center. The rooms are modern and clean, and the bathrooms are exceptional.  Granted, space is limited and there's no wow factor here. But the staff are great and really cater to tourists. As always in a big city, try to get a high room toward the back, and with AC. Not all rooms have AC, so I was fortunate. The price is high compared to what you pay for nicer hotels in the states, but it was in line with similar properties in Dublin.

title: Fantastic hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we really value all guest feedback, as we are always looking to improve the service we provide.  We are delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us, and we able to make the most of our central location- we really are fortunate to be within walking distance of all of the main sites that Dublin has to offer.  We shall also pass your comments on to the whole team here, as we really focus on our customer service.  If you return to Dublin in the future, we shall be delighted to look after you once more. Please contact our front desk team directly and we shall of course offer you a return guest discount, as well as doing our best to ensure an air conditioned room. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Perfect location!
review: Excellent location. Really exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Best I've ever experienced. Very central and ideal location for a night out. Staff were great and beds really comfy. Wud recommend for defo

title: Great location
review: Really enjoyed our stay here. Finally found a hotel in Dublin that's reasonably priced and yet is comfortable. Newly renovated in the last 9 months. Great location, very central. Parked in Stephens green car park and got a great rate for the 48 hours, courtesy of the hotel, €25.  Quirky bar adjoining the hotel, may not be appealing to older residents.

title: Drury Court Hotel 7/23/14
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your kind review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to read that you found your stay to be comfortable, as we have indeed recently updated all of the facilities and decor in our rooms, and that you enjoyed our central location.  It was a pleasure to be able to provide you with our concessionary rate in St. Stephen's Green car park on this stay; however, if you return to Dublin again, please contact us directly at reception (014751988) and we shall be delighted to allocate you one of our limited on-site car parking spaces. We look forward to welcoming you again in the future, Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Apartment stay
review: The customer service was awesome at this hotel.  Very accommodating and very informative.  The location is perfect and within walking distance of all the major attractions in downtown Dublin.  The restaurant connected to the hotel was amazing and had many beers on tap including some craft beers.  Some of the rooms are not air conditioned so definitely ask for a room with air conditioning if that is important to you.  The only negative thing would be the beds were not that comfortable and it would have been nice to have a safe in the room.  Other than that the Drury Court is definitely worth the money and I would stay here again.

title: Great location - wonderful staff
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel during your time in Dublin, and we are so glad to read that you were able to make the most of our central location. We really do value our customer service in the hotel, and shall pass on your kind remarks about our accommodating staff to the whole front desk team here, as well as to the team in the neighbouring P. Mac's bar. Thank you also for your suggestions for improvements in the rooms- we shall certainly take these on board, as we are always looking to develop the service we provide.  We would be delighted to see you again at the Drury Court Hotel if you return to Dublin in the future; please contact us directly at reception and we shall offer you a discount off your next stay with us. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Great staff!!
review: The apartment was clean and tidy and the bedrooms were of a good size.  The kitchen was quite small and could be used by only one person at a time. The bathroom which also included the only toilet was adequate. With 5 adults staying in the apartment scheduling of the bathroom and toilet was difficult.   Seating in the small lounge area was also limited to four seats and additional chairs had to be brought in from the bedrooms. There was also no table or chairs to enable us all to sit together for any meals.  The apartment wracked out onto a small lane which was noisy late at night and early in the morning.

title: Lovely staff & great location
review: Early checkin was made possible. Room was spacious, clean, a wee leak on the floor into the bathroom, but nothing to be bothered about. Very good breakfast. Nice helpful staff. I would definitely return.

title: Great location -- Great service
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you ever so much for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. It was a pleasure to be able to help with an early check in, and we are so glad to read that you found the room to be spacious and clean. Thank you also for making us aware of the small leak in the bathroom- we have since had our maintenance team attend to this for future guests. We shall be sure to pass on your kind remarks about the friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really value our customer service.  Please contact us directly at reception if you return to Dublin in the future and we shall be sure to provide you with a discount off your next stay. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: great spot
review: Super location.  I was able to walk everywhere.  The room was clean and the staff was very helpful.  I was up early one day before breakfast and they prepared something for me to take along.  That is real customer service.   Would definitely stay here again.

title: Beer Budget hotel with Champagne prices
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel - we are delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us, and were able to make the most of our central location. We shall be sure to pass on your kind comments about our friendly staff to the whole team here; it was a pleasure to be able to assist you with an early breakfast whilst you made the most of your time exploring Ireland.  If you return to Dublin again, please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you a discount off any future stays. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: super location with brilliant service
review: slam bang in the centre off dublin  lovely staff cant fault this hotel will be back  great if your going to shows in gaitey theatre around the corner  and for shopping in grafton street little gem local pubs and cafes all around u

title: Brilliant place to stay!
review: We booked this hotel because we wanted to be near the Gaity theatre. The location of hotel is perfect. (Riverdance was brilliant too!) lots of bars and shops very close by. Room was a family room and was very large and clean/comfortable. The full irish breakfast was massive and hot, tasty and very filling. Will be returning to this hotel very soon.

title: Small hotel with high quality in the senter of town
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to hear that you made the most of our central location, and enjoyed your visit to Riverdance- we certainly are lucky to be so conveniently located for the Gaiety Theatre.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel, and we would be delighted to see you for a second stay in the future. Please contact us directly at reception if you are in Dublin in the future, and we shall of course offer you a return guest discount. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Good hotel in a great location .
review: This small hotel is in the center of town, south of the river Liffey. It is only 5-10 minutes walking distance to different areas such as  •	Sentral walking/pedestrian area as Grafton Streeet •	Tourist attractions such as The Castle of Dublin, St Patrick Cathedral, Trinity College, The Wax Museum and more. •	Temple area with many bars, restauras og theaters •	Recreationsareas (parks) som St Stephen’s Green and Merrion Square Park.  The atmosphere in the hotel is relaxed, and it is easy to have a nice time in this hotel. The staff is very nice and pleasant. They know very well what a tourist in Dublin should do and see. They did a very good job, thanks a lot.

title: Outstanding
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to hear that you made the most of our central location- we are so fortunate to be within walking distance of Dublin's main sites and recreation areas. We shall also pass on your kind remarks about our pleasant and helpful staff to the whole team here, as we really focus on customer service.   We would be delighted to welcome you to our hotel again in the future; please contact us at reception and we shall of course offer you a return guest discount. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: “Awesome place , lovely staff”
review: Good hotel in a great location. Rooms were clean but decor was a bit dated. Good breakfast and the meal in the bar was also very nice. I would certainly stay here again. Good value with handy parking .

title: Great value, clean, large and comfortable room
review: I came for a one-night stay and got a great last-minute deal (about $65 for a night). I wasn't looking for anything fancy, so I was happy to see that the room was a pretty decent size. No conditioner, just shampoo, for your planning purposes. The area can be somewhat noisy at night, even on a Sunday evening. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location.

title: Great Place For Seeing Dublin
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your kind review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our central location- we really are fortunate to be in the heart of Dublin's city centre. We do apologise that there was not conditioner in your room; this is something that we do usually supply, and have plenty of reception. However, we are glad that you found the room spacious and comfortable.  It was a pleasure to welcome you to our hotel, and we would love to see you again in the future. Please contact us directly at reception if you are back in Dublin and we shall of course offer you a return guest discount. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Great hotel, amazing location
review: Location is wonderful. Easy walk to just about everything in central Dublin. Hotel is not large or fancy, but it is attractive and clean with good-sized rooms, decently large bathroom and a very good shower. The hotel seems as if it should be noisy, considering the location, but is actually very quiet. Not a B&B, but the attached pub is also a restaurant where breakfast and other meals are available.  But the neighborhood is full of choices from cute little tea/coffee shops to full-fledged restaurants. We stayed for 3 days before doing a driving tour of Ireland, and liked it so much we booked three more days when we returned to Dublin.  But the best thing about the hotel?  The staff!  Friendly, personable, helpful and ready to answer any question.  Can't say enough about how…

title: Great for family
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed our central location, and that you were not disturbed by any external noise during your time with us. We shall also pass on your lovely comments about our friendly and helpful staff to the whole team here as we really do focus on customer service.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you during your time in Dublin, and we would love to see you again in the future. Please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you a return guest discount. Warmest regards, Emma House

title: An excellent 05 days in Dublin
review: Stayed there for a week, room was nice (a mini bar or a fridge would be even nicer!). Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and had great recommendations.  But most important is LOCATION! The neighborhood where the hotel is, has all the bars, restaurants and shops one can ask for. Vibrant and party atmosphere all around. 10 minutes walk from the Temple Bar if you insist, but IMO, an even better area.

title: Family room - quite room and very friendly staff !
review: I booked a room for 3 (family) only a few days before travelling. It was a surprise for us: centrally located, but no noise from the street - clean room - a very helpful and friendly staff - and a convenient opportunity to get a breakfast is right next to the hotel.  Great location , looking forward to our next stay in Dublin!

title: Fantastic hotel experience!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay in one of our suites. We are certainly fortunate to be so conveniently located in Dublin's city centre.  We shall also pass on your lovely comments about our helpful and friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really pride ourselves on our customer service.   If you are in Dublin in the future, please contact us directly at reception and we shall be delighted to offer you a return guest discount off your next stay.  Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Apartment stay - Fantastic
review: The staff was one of the friendliest I have ever encountered. The manager, Sofia, was so accommodating and went out of her way to help us. The room was great and we heard no noise from the busy street below. Dublin was our last stop on our 2 week self-guided tour. Thankfully this hotel was pretty central to everything we wanted to see. I think the furthest away we had to venture was maybe 15 minutes. Great location, great staff, and very clean!

title: Great result for a last minute booking!!
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we are delighted to hear that you found our location to be so convenient. We shall also pass on your kind comments about our friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really focus on customer service.   It would be a pleasure to welcome you back to the Drury Court Hotel in the future; if you would like to make a return booking with us here, please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you a discounted rates for any future reservations.  Kindest regards,  Sofia Aguilar del Toro

title: Great Service, Great Location
review: We stayed in an apartment which is right beside the hotel. There were 4 of us. One double bedroom and a sofa bed in the living room. The room was huge, 2 two seater sofas, a dining table and a great kitchen with a combined washing machine and tumble dryer!!! Almost like being at home as there was almost everything already there, hairdryer, washing powder etc. As for location, wow, amazing! 2 mins away from Grafton St, beside Temple Bar area and College Green. The reception staff were friendly and helpful too. You will not be disappointed if you book this apartment!

title: Great location for shopping and sight seeing.
review: We stayed in the hotel for three nights this June and were very satisfied with the experience - grandparents, children and young grandchildren.  The hotel was very convenient to all the shops around Grafton Street as well as the galleries, museums and Guinness Brewery. The hotel was very clean, the staff very helpful with taxis/phone calls etc., the beds very comfortable and most importantly, the windows ensured that it was very quiet at night even though the neighborhood has lots of restaurants and bars - I especially wanted a quiet hotel.  We spent two weeks traveling around Ireland and for the price this was one of the best value and comfort hotels we stayed in.  The car park is a little difficult to get into with a large 9 seater van but it did fit - call ahead to ensure a…

title: great location
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel- we really value all guest feedback as we are always looking to improve the service we provide. We are so glad to hear that you found our location to be so convenient, we really are lucky to be within walking distance of all of Dublin's main attractions. We shall also pass on your kind comments about our friendly staff and clean rooms to the Front Desk and Housekeeping staff here.  We do hope that you enjoyed the rest of your time in Dublin and would love to welcome you again in the future. Please contact us directly at reception and we shall ensure you receive a return guest discount, as well as our complimentary onsite parking.  Best,  Emma House

title: Very good location indeed and nice people serving
review: This hotel has a fabulous location just minutes away from Grafton street. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing seemed too much trouble. The room was comfortable but a bit too hot as opening the window meant traffic noise. The bar downstairs was very busy with a very small residents area. The breakfast was served in the bar area and was more than ample.

title: Superb location, excellent staff
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. It was a pleasure to welcome you to our hotel and we are so glad to read that you enjoyed our central location. We shall also pass on your kind comments about our friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really do focus on customer service.  We would love to see you again in the future, please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you a return guest discount. We can also assign you one of our air-conditioned rooms or provide you with a fan on the room should we be so lucky again with the warm weather on your return stay! Kindest regards, Emma House

title: A most pleasant stay.
review: Drury Court Hotel is a nice play to stay and know the best of Dublin. Its privileged location puts you among lots of restaurants, cafes and stores in Dublin centre. Room and bathroom were absolutely clean. People serving at the restaurant, for the breakfast, were nice, as well as, people on the front desk that were very helpful and gentle.

title: Great Location!
review: The Drury Court Hotel was in the most amazing location in Dublin.  Very centrally located to everything.  The hotel was quaint with nice rooms.  The staff was very friendly.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Amazing
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and made the most of our central location.   It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel for your time in Dublin; we would love to see you again in the future for a second stay with us. If you return to Dublin, please do not hesitate to be in touch directly and we shall of course offer you a discount off your next stay.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Fantastic Location, Easy to find by car and Carpark close by.
review: Great hotel, not too expensive, clean rooms of great sizes, great cleaning and reception service and a great staff, everything you could ask for located in a great spot of the city because you have easy access to a lot of local stores,  shopping malls and in a walking distance to many museums and main attractions (like St. Patrick's Cathedral and Dublin's Castle), and close to all the bus lines like the hop-on hop-off buses. Definitely a great option to stay in Dublin!

title: Great little hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your time with us, and made the most of our central location; we are certainly lucky to be conveniently located for all of the main sites of Dublin.  We shall also be sure to pass on your comments about our friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really pride ourselves on our customer service. It was a pleasure to welcome you to our hotel and this occasion, and we would be delighted to offer you a return discount if you stay with us in the future. Please contact us at reception to avail of this. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Great location and friendly staff
review: If you are coming by car there is a car park directly opposite the Hotel offering discounted rates for overnight parking.  I booked a double room through booking.com but would have liked a triple as my daughter was travelling with us. The option was not available through the web so she decided to stay with friends at the Radisson.  When my Mother and I checked in we discovered a large room with a single and a double, perfect for three.  I asked the reception if we could add my daughter to the booking, no problem , I was told.  they only charged an extra 20 Euro.  perfect. Staff were very hlpful and most accommodating.   The bar below the hotel (P Macs ) was very interesting and welcoming.  great indi rock kind of place.  very relaxed and visited mostly by the Irish people.  not…

title: Fantastic location
review: An awesome location at a really great price.  The staff was so pleasant and helpful.  The windows in the room were a set of inner and outer windows.  When both were closed the sound from the pub below was virtually erased.  Wish I could have stayed more than one night.

title: Absoutely Amazing
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we are so glad to hear that you found our location to be convenient, we really are lucky to be in the heart of Dublin here. We shall also pass on your kind comments about our helpful staff to the whole team here, as we really do focus on customer service. It was such a pleasure to welcome you on this occasion, even for a short stay, and we would love to see you again in the future. Please let us know at reception directly if you return to Dublin and we shall of course offer you a discount off any future bookings.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Great Hotel near center of Dublin
review: Found this hotel last minute booking! All employees were awesome. The nice employee checking us in was patient with us answered all our questions. They let us keep our luggage there for the day after check out! We went back that night and they helped us get to airport easily! Very Very helpful! Would recommend to anyone! Great, fantastic place! The room was clean, so was the bathroom :-)

title: Great hotel close to everything.
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to let us know about your stay at the Drury Court Hotel- we are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, and that you found our staff to be so friendly and helpful. We shall pass on your kind comments to the whole team here, as we really focus on our customer service.   We would love to welcome you again for a second stay with us; please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course off you the return guest discount for any future reservations. Best, Emma House

title: Ideal!
review: Great location within walking distance of most Dublin attractions, pubs, and restaurants. We stayed in a nicely furnished 3 Bedroom apartment with basic necessities. Was definitely big enough for a family of 5 adults. The staff were extremely helpful and nice, providing suggestions and directions for local favorites. Would definitely stay here again.

title: A great stay at the Drury Court Hotel in Dublin, Ireland
review: Our family of four stayed in one of the family rooms at the Drury and loved it!  Lot's of room and very quiet (despite the adjacent Bia Bar).  The hotel is very centrally located, which made access very easy by foot (we did not have a vehicle).  The staff was also very friendly and accommodating.  Book without worry.

title: Great location
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you ever so much for your kind comments regarding your stay at the Drury Court Hotel- it was such a pleasure to welcome you and your family.  We are delighted to hear that you found our rooms quiet and spacious, whilst also being well located. We shall also pass on your remarks about our accommodating and friendly staff to the team here.  If you return to Dublin again in the future, please do not hesitate to contact us directly and we shall do our best to ensure you receive the same room, as well as a return guest discount, off your next booking. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Great for a quick overnight trip!
review: Great location close to everything, large bedroom and bathroom with good facilities. Friendly and helpful  staff. Local people so helpful, if you stopped to look at a map someone would ask if they could help.

title: The staff was extremely helpful and hospitable.
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your kind comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we are so glad to read that you enjoyed your time in Dublin and made the most of our central location. We shall also pass on your lovely remarks about our friendly staff to the whole team here.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel on this occasion; please let us know if you are in Dublin in the future, we would love to see you for a second stay and shall of course offer you the return guest discount. We look forward to hearing from you, Best, Emma House

title: Perfect for a tourist in Dublin
review: Stayed for one night with my husband and was pleasantly surprised.  Very central and easy to find.  The Air Coach drops you off a 5 minute walk away! The room was ready for us when we arrived at 11 which was a great surprise. When we checked out the staff were happy to hold our bag most of the day before we left for our flight home.  The desk staff were kind and courteous, the hotel and room were bright and clean. We had windows that allowed plenty of fresh air into our room during these warm days.  The only two negatives were the extreme temperature swings while taking a shower and the very noisy street traffic (glass collection was Wednesday early morning!).  Not a deal breaker for the price we paid.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect location
review: Drury Court Hotel is perfectly located for all sightseeing, shopping, restaurants, pubs, entertainment, and a nearby car park if you rent a car. It's easy walking distance to Grafton Street, Trinity College, St. Stephen's Green, Temple Bar, Dublin Castle, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Christ Church, and the waterfront. Our room was comfortable and clean. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. One suggestion when booking - Not all rooms have air conditioning. This was not too challenging in latter May but could be uncomfortable in warmer months. So, depending on when you're traveling, you might want to consider specifically requesting a room with air conditioning.

title: Smack, bang in the middle.
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your recent review of your stay at the Drury Court Hotel; it was a real pleasure to welcome you to Dublin, and we are delighted to read that you found our location to be so convenient. We are certainly fortunate to be within walking distance of all that Dublin has to offer in terms of sights, bars and restaurants. We are also glad to hear that you found our staff to be so friendly, as we really pride ourselves on our customer service.   We would love to see you again at the Drury Court Hotel if you return to Dublin and shall of course offer you the return guest discount off any future stays with us. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Drury Court, Dublin
review: My fiancee and I booked this hotel literally hours before we went down and managed to get one of the last apartments available. We could not have asked for a better location in one of our favourite spots in the city. The hotel is roughly two minutes away from St Stephen's Green and five minutes from Grafton street. Right next door to the hotel is P.Macs, one of the best bars in Dublin with a great atmosphere and an unrivalled selection of drinks for trying.  The apartment itself was homey, clean and comfortable. Not much to talk about in the way of views but we were only really interested in somewhere to lay our heads. The room was cleaned when we were out and there was no issues at all with cleanliness. Staff at the desk were very polite, helpful and made us feel at ease. The…

title: I enjoyed the Drury Court
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely review of your recent stay in one of our apartments at the Drury Court Hotel.   We are delighted to hear that you found the apartments to be homely and clean, and that you found the location to be so convenient. We are certainly lucky to be located in the heart of everything that Dublin has to offer- including P. Mac's bar with its great atmosphere. We shall also pass on your comments about our friendly staff to the whole team here.   Please contact us directly at reception next time you are in Dublin and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount, as well as complimentary onsite parking should it be required. We look forward to hearing from you again,  Kindest regards, Emma House

title: well recommended
review: I stayed in this hotel on June 3rd when in Dublin on business.  I was only there for one night but can recommend it.  The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The location was perfect for me as it was a little over 5 minutes walk to my office but it is also an excellent location from a social point of view.  It is only minutes from the shops on Grafton Street and in the course of a ten minute ramble I came across, Spanish, Italian, French, Japanese and Indian restaurants and numerous pubs. I would certainly use it again.

title: Very friendly staff
review: We stayed here recently for 2 nights, and we had an OK stay.   The pros: the staff was very friendly and accommodating; the location is perfect, centrally located to nearly everything; the rooms were fairly clean; free WiFi.  The cons: the shower was not great, just a sad little stream of water, no water pressure; the shower curtain had mildew on it; the hotel bar/restaurant is a major hotspot, which could be great if you want to party all night, but if you want a hotel where you can go have a relaxing nightcap and wind down, this is not it; and finally, because of the bar scene, it's very loud, even in the rooms, until the early hours of the morning.  It wasn't a bad stay, and I appreciate the staff's friendliness, but for the cost, we'll probably stay elsewhere next time we're…

title: loved Drury Court
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your recent review of the Drury Court Hotel; we are always looking to improve the service we provide and really welcome both positive and negative comments from our guests.  We are delighted to hear that you found our central location to be so convenient for sightseeing, and that you found our staff to be so friendly and helpful- we shall definitely pass these comments on to the whole team here.  However, we are disappointed to learn that you were disturbed by the nightlife from the surrounding area; we have installed triple glazing in all of our rooms to try and keep this to a minimum, but unfortunately it was a very busy bank holiday time when you were staying with us. If you do return to the Drury Court Hotel, we would be delighted to assign you a room on a high floor at the back of the building to hopefully reduce any external noise.  Similarly, please rest assured that we have taken your comments on board regarding our bathroom facilities, and are currently in the middle of an upgrade to all bathrooms, including the water pressure in showers.  If you are in Dublin in the future, we would love to welcome you back to hopefully redress the negative impression you received on this occasion. Please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount. Best, Emma House

title: So-so hotel, great location
review: We chose Drury Court due to its central location to the main sites of Dublin.  We only had a couple days and wanted to maximize our time there. We had a lovely room,  roomy and impeccably clean.  The windows minimize Street noise,  which makes a great night's sleep on the comfortable bed.  If it was hot,  and Windows need to be open,  the noise would be a problem... thankfully Dublin's weather shouldn't have this problem.  The reception staff are incredibly helpful and always friendly and welcoming.  We had the breakfast which was quite good,  although my first walk into a bar for breakfast was a trifle strange until welcomed by the staff.  I think you'll enjoy your stay at Drury Court and find it quite competitively priced.

title: lovely modern hotel, great central location.
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel.  It was a pleasure to welcome you to Dublin as part of your vacation in Ireland, and we are so glad to hear that you found the rooms to be clean and our staff to be friendly and welcoming. We shall certainly pass on your kind comments to the whole team here.  We hope that you enjoyed the rest of your time in Ireland, and would be delighted to welcome you back in the future. Please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: High standards for a 3 stars in the UK
review: My mom and I recently spent 10 days traveling throughout Ireland, and since we flew into the Dublin airport we figured we'd spend our first night there. Although we had a car, we wanted a hotel in a central area so we could walk to everything we wanted to do (see some castles, go shopping, eat, hit some bars) since driving/parking in any city you're unfamiliar with is always a pain.  We chose the Drury Court Hotel because of its prime location and its cost. It was one of the more expensive hotels we stayed in ($160/night), but it was probably the worst in terms of amenities and cleanliness.   The staff was really nice and helpful—we got lost trying to find them and their carpark but when we called they gave us some tips on how to find them (hint: the hotel is sort of hidden…

title: Functional place, very nice and gentle staff
review: The position is very good to go and visit the city centre of Dublin and all around walking...the staff is always helpful. The quality/price report is good. There is also a powerful hairdryer. I think It is important to say that cause girls (or, why not, men) who has long hair (as I have) can leave their hairdryer at home avoiding to fill their luggage unecessarily. The room had been cleaned every day, and every day towels had been changed. You can get there catching the bus number 16 from the airport. Very convenient. My friends and I liked it. We are from Italy so We care about cleaning, so you can trust us :P

title: Amazing location and wonderful staff
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel, we really appreciate all comments from our guests as we are always looking to update the service we provide.  We are delighted to hear that you found our location to be so convenient; we are certainly very fortunate to be so close to everything in the centre of Dublin. We shall also pass on your lovely remarks about the cleanliness of the rooms to the whole housekeeping team here.  Please let us know if you return to Dublin in the future and we shall be delighted to offer you a return guest discount off any future stays with us.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: very Convenient Hotel..
review: My boyfriend and I had originally planned on staying in Dublin for the first 4 nights and then traveling around to other parts of the country. We booked the hotel for the 4 nights and by the 2nd we decided that we liked it and the area so much that we wanted to just stay the entire 10 days here. The staff was very accommodating and offered a discount for booking the extra days with them.  The location was fantastic. A short walk to the Temple Bar area, all of the tourist attractions and all the restaurants and pubs you could ever want.  I was nervous about staying here because there were many reviews about the noise being too much to sleep, but we had no problems at all. We stayed on the 4th floor that faced out onto the street and were right above the bar.  I think the best…

title: Great location for everything to see and do in downtown Dublin
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel- it was a real pleasure to welcome both you and your boyfriend to our hotel during your time in Ireland, and we were delighted that you chose to extend your stay with us.  We are so glad to read that you found our location so convenient, as we really are in the heart of all that Dublin has to offer. We shall also pass on your kind remarks about our friendly staff to the whole team here- in particular Jason- as we really pride ourselves on our customer service.  We hope that you had a safe return journey, and would love to welcome you back to the Drury Court Hotel if you do return to Dublin in the future. Please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount for any future stays. Warmest regards, Emma House

title: wonderful place
review: First stay at the Hotel in Dublin as I usually stay at the Grafton Capitol next door.For the first time this was Cheaper and was very near to my meeting pplace,about 200 Yards only.Very much in the City centre and conveniently Located near the Stephens Green and all the Small eating Joints on Grafton Street.The Breakfast is served in the Pub but a basic one but worth the money defintely. The reception looks small but the Rooms are quite Big and much more TV channels then Grafton capitol and also free WiFi. Would stay here the next time also. Lots of eating options close by with a Thai Noodle Bar opposite and there is a Tea Lounge right next door which serves all types and concotions of Tea which we would have never heard of but very vitalising.

title: A good choice
review: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. We booked through the hotel website and because of the length of our stay we got a 15% discount. This meant that we got a very good deal for the quality and location of this hotel. From our experience, there was little to fault in this hotel - its location is absolutely brilliant - most sights, attractions and restaurants are a short, leisurely stroll from the hotel. Our room was really nice - big, comfortable and very clean. In spite of a bar located right next to the hotel, our room (which, admittedly was on the top floor) was quiet and peaceful. Our only snag during our stay was that there was not enough hot water and the water pressure was too low. We spoke to the (very attentive and very friendly) reception staff and they kindly…

title: Great Value
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We welcome all feedback, both positive and negative, as we are always looking to upgrade the service we provide.  We are delighted to hear that you considered the room to be a good deal- the 3 night discount is only offered through our own website, and is great for longer stays. We are also glad to hear that you found our location to be so convenient, as almost everything Dublin has to offer is within walking distance from our hotel. We sincerely apologise for the issue you experienced with the pressure in your shower, and thank you very much for bringing this to our attention. We are currently in the process of renovating the entire plumbing system to ensure a consistent service for our guests, and this is due to be completed within the next couple of weeks.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to the Drury Court for your five days in Dublin, and we would love to welcome you back in the future should you return to the city. Please contact us directly at reception for any return bookings and we shall offer you a return guest discount off your next stay.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Central located, nice rooms, great service
review: Great location, great staff. Rooms are clean good size comfortable beds good size bathroom fantastic value for such a great location. We walked to great bars and restaurants in the area and originally booked as it was close to the beautiful Gaiety Theatre where we had booked to see a show

title: Drury Court Hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your recent review of the Drury Court Hotel and the lovely comments regarding your stay. We are so glad to hear that you found our rooms spacious and comfortable, and to be good value. We shall also pass on your kind remarks regarding our great staff to the whole team here, as we really pride ourselves on customer service.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel on this occasion, and we do hope you enjoyed the show at the Gaiety Theatre- they have a great programme this year! We would be delighted to welcome you back in the future; please contact us directly at reception if you are back in Dublin again and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Great Stay
review: Nicely located hotel with walking distance to all major Dublin attractions. Nice and comfortable rooms, good service in advance (how to get there, nice things to see) and very friendly personnel. I'll make sure I book this hotel again next time I'm in Dublin!

title: Perfect location
review: We stayed for a week and found it to be perfect for us. Very comfortable bed. It can get VERY loud what with 3 bars just below. The 4am clean up of the beer bottles was jarring at first, but we slept right through it after the first night. The restaurant/bar just below has great breakfast and coffee. Our flight arrived in the morning and the front desk held our luggage for us until the room was ready while we explored the area.

title: Great place to stay!
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely review of your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we really value all customer feedback as we are always looking to improve the service that we provide.  We are so glad to hear that you found our location to be convenient, and it was a pleasure to hold your luggage for your whilst you enjoyed your first day in Dublin.  We do hope that the external noise was not too distracting; we have done all that we can to combat this with the addition of triple glazing throughout the hotel.  We would love to welcome you back should you return to Dublin in the future; please contact us directly at reception and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Welcome to Dublin
review: Loved my experience at Drury. The prices are reasonable, the location is great, the staff was super friendly, and the rooms were clean. The staff even made phone calls for us to arrange dinner reservations, tours, etc. I stayed for 5 nights.

title: Nothing to complain about, good location
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you ever so much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel and for your kind remarks.  We are so glad to hear that you found our hotel to be good value and our rooms to be clean. We shall also pass on your comments about our friendly staff to the whole team here, as we really pride ourselves on our customer service. It was a real pleasure to help you out with reservations and phone calls, we do hope that you enjoyed your time here in Dublin. If you return in the future, please contact us directly at reception and we shall be delighted to offer you the return guest discount.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Brilliant hotel, amazing staff and relaxing stay!
review: We recently stayed at Drury Court for 3 nights. It was really very good, great central location, just 5 minutes walk to Grafton St, with lots of shops, entertainment, and eating places. Only a short walk to Temple Bar and the river. Room was excellent and very clean, staff really friendly, good breakfast. Hairy Lemon pub across the road was a fantastic place to eat. We'd definitely stay there again.

title: Great location, staff where fab
review: The hotel was really central. 15 mins walk to oconnell bridge which meant we where close to everything.  The bar in the hotel was very friendly an great fun.  Room service was prompt an very friendly staff.  Emma on reception was absolutely fab an went the extra mile she made our stay great nothin was to much trouble for her. Room was great big enough just for two clean enough.  Would defo stay again

title: Average stay ... convenient location and nice breakfast!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to the hotel and we are so glad to hear that you found all of our staff to be attentive and friendly- I shall be sure to pass this on to the whole team here.  We would be delighted to welcome you back for a second stay in the future; please contact us directly at reception to avail of your return guest discount. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Cheap if you are just looking for a bed for the night!
review: Located in the heart of Dublin, Drury court is hardly a few minutes (walkable) away from Dublin's tourist areas like temple bar, O'Connell street, Ilac center. The overall experience was average because the rooms are not very up-to-date. The breakfast was awesome as the chef prepared really nice mushrooms quickly on request .... and the reception staff was nice and courteous too.   Rooms and the interiors don't have the modern look and require minor upgrades. Stayed here for just two nights but the smell in the room made me feel a bit uncomfortable.

title: Great Location, Clean and Friendly Apartment Stay
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your stay at the Drury Court Hotel.  We are so glad to hear that you found our central location so convenient- we are very lucky with our position, as all that Dublin has to offer is just a short walk away.  However, we are sorry to hear that you did not feel our rooms were up-to-date, we are currently in the process of renovating all of our soft furnishings in all of our rooms. We would be delighted to welcome you back once these renovations have been completed to hopefully redress the negative impression you received on this occasion.  We do hope that you mentioned any issues regarding the smell of the room to the staff at reception during your stay, as we would certainly have been happy to move your room or address the issue directly that we were informed.  We would very much like the opportunity to welcome you back in the future; please contact us directly at reception to avail of your return guest discount. Best, Emma House

title: Good hotel in city center
review: Cheap and Cheerful if you are just looking for a weekend stay and just want a bed. Lift was broken when we were there (Level 5 we were placed on and not that I have objections to walking the stairs as it is good exercise) but I wouldn't like to be an older person having to do this.  It was advertised on the website that the lift would be broken so we were well aware of this when booking the room.  We stayed 2 nights and I think our bill was a little over 100 euros for the 2 of us so you can not go wrong with price if you are just looking for a room.  Staff were extremely friendly when checking in and rooms are very clean. There was a noise coming from the roof, a tap leaking and we were put beside the staff room so could be a bit noisy at times. Parking is accessible and cheap…

title: Three Nighter
review: We picked the Drury Court rather by chance and were a bit worried whether we had done the right thing.  But we had no reason to be - we were made very welcome when we arrived and left our car in the secure parking area (make sure you pre-book as it is not very large).  The room was large and comfortable with plenty of space to hang clothes etc.  Also a proper bathroom and not just a showeroom.  Breakfast is in the bar below which also does other meals but there is so much to choose from round about we did not use it.  Yes, slap bang in the middle of Dublin with all the tourist attractions in easy walking distance.  Would we go back - you bet we would!

title: Good central location
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted that you selected our hotel for your three night stay in Dublin and that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We are so glad to read that you found our rooms to be large and comfortable, and it was a real pleasure to provide you with onsite parking for the duration of your time with us. We really are lucky with our central location here, and are happy to hear that you made the most of it!  We would love to welcome you back in the future for a second stay with us; please contact us directly at reception for your next reservation to avail of a return guest discount, as well as onsite parking. We look forward to hearing from you, Warmest regards, Emma House

title: over night stay
review: Great location on the south side of Dublin. Close to a great variety of quality shops. Restaurants are all close by and suit all budgets. Some lovely traditional Dublin pubs are also in the area. Great overall for a night in Dublin.

title: Great Hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel.  We are glad to hear that you found our central location so convenient- we really are lucky with our surroundings, especially when it comes to great restaurants and pubs.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to the Drury Court on this occasion; if you return to Dublin in the future, please contact us directly at reception and we shall be delighted to offer you the return guest discount. Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Good location and friendly service
review: Went up to Dublin for a weekend night out to see a friends band and stayed in Drury Court. This was our first time in this hotel having stayed in a number of others, but I must say we had a great time and we will be going back again. The location is second to none beside Stephens green with parking on site. There are a second set of windows so even though we were in the centre of Dublin not a sound was to be heard. Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable, the room was clean and the bed comfortable.

title: Lovely
review: Stayed at the Drury Court for 3 nights. The staff were so nice from the moment we walked in to when we left and were very helpful. It's a good location, probably a 5 or 10 minute walk to Temple Bar which is a fantastic night out. Didn't do much of the typical tourist sightseeing during the day so not sure what the locations like for things like that although most things seem in walking distance. Overall I can't fault the hotel or the place and would definitely come back. Just bring plenty to spend too because it's a bit pricey when you get here but its worth it. Also coming to and from the Airport we used the Airlink bus service. It was much cheaper than a taxi. It's only €10 return and definitely worth doing.

title: Perfect location
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we really value all guest feedback, as we are always looking to improve the service we provide.   We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, and we shall pass on your kind remarks about our friendly staff to the whole team here. We are also glad to hear that you managed to visit Temple Bar and enjoy Dublin's nightlife during your time here- our location is second to none, especially for heading out in the evenings!  It was a real pleasure to welcome you on this occasion, and we would be very glad to offer you the return guest discount off any future stays. Please contact reception directly to avail of this. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Average hotel - good location
review: While not plush, this hotel is in the best location possible. The room was kept clean and the staff was helpful. We could walk to everything. Even though we were in the heart of Dublin the room was quiet. We would recommend this hotel.

title: nice hotel, perfect location
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your kind comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel.  We are delighted to hear that you found our location to be peaceful but convenient - we really are fortunate with our central position here. We shall also pass on your kind comments about our helpful staff to the whole team here.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel on this occasion and we shall be very glad to offer you the return guest discount for any future stays; please contact us directly at reception to avail of this.  Kindest regards, Emma House

title: another great stay!
review: Stayed at Drury Court Hotel over Easter. Location is excellent. Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and close to tourist spots. Room is average, with all basic stuff and clean.  The only inconvenience: Some noise at times from other guests on the corridors and workers in a next-door room.

title: Great Hotel
review: Great hotel, in a great area for Grafton Street, St Stephens Green ect. Room was nice and big, better than some of the more expensive hotels we have stayed in Dublin. We stay in Dublin alot as husband works there so been to a lot of hotels, but will be returning here.

title: Drury Court is excellent
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you ever so much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel and for your lovely comments.  We are delighted that you found our rooms to be spacious and in a convenient location, especially for Grafton Street and Stephen's Green.  It was a pleasure to welcome you to the hotel on this occasion and we would love to welcome you back in the future- please contact us directly at reception on 014751988 and we shall be delighted to offer you the return guest discount, as well as complimentary onsite parking should you require this.  Best, Emma House

title: Very central, nice hotel
review: Wonderful experience; excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, clean and comfortable, large rooms.  I was very happy with the Drury Court.  And the price was very reasonable compared to other hotels in the downtown area.

title: Great find in Dublin
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to read that you enjoyed your stay, and found our rooms to be clean and comfortable. We shall also pass on your kind feedback about our friendly staff to the whole team here, as customer service is a real focus for us.  It was a pleasure to welcome you to the Drury Court Hotel, and we do hope that you had a great time exploring Dublin. If you return to this area in the future, please contact the reception directly and we shall be delighted to offer you the return guest discount.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Perfect hotel for a stay in the centre of town.
review: We stay just one Saturday night.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  We were on the third floor, and the windows were quite noise-insulating.  This is an issue in the area because it's quite lively around this area, particularly on the weekend.  First floor might have been a problem given there's a pub directly below.  That said, we slept fine.  Very close to lots of tourist sites, and places to go out/restaurants/pubs.  Shower was "OK" - a bit old, and fixed to the wall.

title: Outstanding little hotel!
review: Great location in Dublin.  Can walk just about anywhere in the city from the hotel.  Excellent staff.  Rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable.  Pub located on ground floor serves breakfast.  Easy walk to mail shopping areas.

title: Convenient, friendly, city centre
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we really value all guest feedback as we always look to improve the service we provide.  We are very glad to hear that you found our location so convenient, as we are close to all of Dublin's main attractions and eating areas. We shall also pass on your kind remarks about our staff to the team here.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to the Drury Court Hotel and we hope that you had a safe return journey. Please contact us directly at reception for any future bookings and we shall of course offer you our return guest discount.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Consistently good, lovely staff, great value
review: Lovely staff, clean and nice accommodation. Great city centre location. Easy to find. Free baggage storage. Good shower pressure. Nice rooms and bed clothing. The living room could do with some interior decoration unification but all was good quality.

title: Good friday good experience
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you ever so much for giving us feedback regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel.   We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us in Dublin and that you found our staff to be friendly and our location convenient. It was also a pleasure to store your bags prior to check in- we shall certainly pass your kind comments on to the team here.  Please contact us directly at reception for any future stays in Dublin and we shall be glad to offer you the return guest discount. We hope to hear from you again and welcome you back to the Drury Court Hotel. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Charming hotel in Stephens Street
review: We've stayed here a number of times and have been really pleased each time. Rooms are spotlessly clean, well kitted out and have everything you need for a comfortable stay at a reasonable price. Location is fantastic. Even though the hotel is slap bang in the city centre, noise in the rooms hasn't been a problem as windows are all well insulated/double glazed. Very friendly staff make the stay very pleasant. We've booked again, so will be back.

title: Location and staff were perfect!
review: From the airport we took the Airlink bus to the "College Green and Temple Bar" stop.  Our walk from there was no more than 10 minutes and that was with a small child in the rain.   Location: 5 minute walk to Grafton Street shopping district, Dunnes grocery 2-3 minute walk, SPAR grocery (open later) 4-5 minute walk, the Famous Temple Bar 8-10 minute walk, 30 minute walk to Houston Rail Station.  The pub next door (name??) is fantastic and you must stop in for at least 1 drink.  Food was just ok.  Atmosphere was fantastic.  Metro ( out the front door, turn right, left at the next street, 1 building down on the right across the street) was a great spot for breakfast....they serve it all day if you're a late sleeper! Staff:  everyone was always helpful and friendly.  Special thanks…

title: Not the best
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you ever so much for your lovely comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We really do value all guest feedback, as we are always looking to update the service we provide to our customers.  We are delighted to hear that you found our location so convenient, as we really are in the heart of everything that Dublin has to offer. We are also very glad to hear that you had a drink in P. Mac's bar next door and sampled some of their impressive beer selection! I shall of course pass on your kind comments about our staff to the whole team here, in particular Maeve, and we thank you for these comments as we pride ourselves on our customer service.  Thank you also for your feedback regarding the comfort of the rooms; we shall certainly take these comments on board and look to address them at the next management meeting. It was a real pleasure to welcome you to the Drury Court Hotel on this occasion- we do hope that you had a safe return journey. We would love to welcome you back in the future; please contact us directly at reception to avail of our return guest discount.  Warmest regards, Emma House Front Desk Manager

title: Excellent value & location
review: Well located in Temple bar area with friendly staff but very limited hotel. Tiny reception area and breakfast comes at an extra cost. There is a very vibrant bar under the hotel thus noise is a problem if you want to keep windows open. This is really a budget hotel which charges a bit more.

title: Good value
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We welcome all guest feedback, both positive and negative, as we are always looking to upgrade the service we provide.  We are sorry to hear that you were not completely satisfied this time with your stay at the Drury Court Hotel. Although we have triple glazing throughout the hotel, the Saturday night of your stay was extremely busy, and therefore it was noisier than usual in the South William Street area. However, if you do return to stay with us, please request a quiet room and we would be delighted to assign you a quiet room on a high floor.  Similarly, for any future bookings, please note that we offer rates both inclusive and exclusive of breakfast for the convenience of all of our guests.   We would love to welcome you back to hopefully remedy the negative impression you received on this occasion- we have also recently undergone an upgrade of the soft furnishings in the room, and can provide fans at no extra cost to rooms during warm weather. Please contact reception directly for any future reservations, and I would be very glad to personally handle your booking.  Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Noise? What noise?
review: Stayed here recently as myself & partner were going to a concert in Dublin. Staff were so friendly and helpful. They even reserved a parking space for us when I rang to book a room at no extra cost. Excellent value and you couldn't get a better location, everything on your doorstep. Will definitely stay here again when in Dublin.

title: drury court hotel
review: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, the staff were very pleasant and helpful, breakfast was delicious and surroundings in breakfast area were fantastic, very quiet and peaceful, but it was Monday night, but hopefully it would be the same weekends.  Would deffo stay again.

title: Everything we wanted!
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel- we really value all feedback from our guests.  It was a real pleasure welcoming you to our hotel, and we are delighted that you enjoyed your stay and found the staff helpful and the room quiet . Although it was a Monday when you stayed, this should not be too different at the weekends as we do have triple glazing in all of our rooms. We shall also pass on your kind comments about the breakfast to the team in P. Mac's.  We would be delighted to offer your a return guest discount off any future stays with us- please contact us directly at reception on +35314751988 to avail of this. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Very good choice for a group staying in Dublin
review: We spent two nights in a three bedroomed apartment, which was located in a building 2 doors down from the actual hotel.  We arrived early and the hotel were happy to hold our luggage while we began exploring the city. They offered us early check-in as soon an apartment became available, free of charge.  When we returned, check-in took less than two minutes and the staff were happy to answer all of our questions.  Reception is open 24 hours, helpful when you have a 6am flight to catch home!  Our apartment was clean, decorated in a warm, modern style and had everything we needed.  The kitchen was compact but had a full-sized oven and hob, a microwave, fridge and even a washing machine.  Wardrobe space was plentiful and the complimentary WiFi was a very welcome addition (router…

title: Wonderful St. Patrick´s Weekend in Dublin
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for your kind comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel, and we are glad that we were able to help out with an early check in, and that you found our staff to be efficient and helpful.  We are delighted to hear that you found the apartment to be decorated in a modern style, clean and that the WiFi was reliable. We shall pass your remarks on to the whole team here. We do hope that you enjoyed your time in Dublin and that you will be back for a second stay in the Drury Court Hotel. Please contact reception directly to avail of your return guest discount off any future bookings.  Warmest regards, Emma House

title: Good value hotel
review: I stayed with other 5 friends (6 people) in the 3 bedroom apartment for three nights. We spent less than staying in Hostels. There is also a kitchen, which works fine. We could cook our own meals.There is a very little terrace ideal to take some fresh air or have a cigarette if you smoke. The service during our staying was very good. Very friendly staff. Also the booking per phone went smoothly and the staff helped us with all our requests. We are all very happy to have chosen it. Ps. position is really good and central - we could reach everything walking. We never had problems because of the noise.

title: Noisy
review: Our room overlooked the attached restaurant/bar...how lovely to hear thumping bass music all evening. Make sure you request a room that doesn't face the alley.   Otherwise, this hotel is in a nice location (quick walk to Temple Bar, Grafton St, etc) and staff were friendly and pleasant.

title: Comfortable hotel in the best location
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We really value all guest feedback, both positive and negative, as we are always looking to improve the service we provide.  We are very glad to hear that you found our location so convenient and our staff to be friendly and helpful- we shall certainly pass this on to our team here.  We sincerely apologise for the noise disturbance you experienced during your stay. Although we have done our very best to limit noise problems by installing triple glazing and curtailing the hours that music is played onsite, our very central location can be subject to noise at peak times.  However, should you make a return stay, we would be delighted to allocate you a high floor at the back of the building. We shall also be delighted to offer you a return guest discount for any future reservations with us.  Kindest regards, Emma House

title: Perfect location.
review: My sister, mother and I stayed in a triple room on Wednesday (12th March) as we were attending a concert.  The hotel room was clean and spacious and they had plenty of towels, toiletries and the beds were comfortable.  This comfortable, convenient hotel was perfect for what we were after.

title: Great short break
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for letting us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We love receiving feedback from our guests, as we are always looking to update the service we provide.  We are delighted to hear that you found our location so convenient- we are indeed within walking distance of most of Dublin's concert venues. We shall also pass on your kind comments about the comfort and cleanliness of our rooms to the housekeeping team here.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel on this occasion; if you are back in Dublin in the future please contact reception directly to avail of your return guest discount. Kindest regards, Emma House

title: fantastic stay
review: We stayed for a night in this hotel when we were going to a production in the Gaeity Theatre. We also wanted to be near pubs/restaurants/shops in the Grafton Street area. The hotel turned out to be in an ideal location for all these things, within walking distance of everything. The staff were very friendly and the room was lovely. The only problem was that our room was at the front of the hotel, and the street is very loud and busy on a Saturday night. The music from the pubs nearby was really loud well into the night and there were loads of people out on the street too so you wouldn't want to be looking for a quiet and peaceful night's sleep! But other than that it was great.

title: Curtain up.
review: We stayed here for one night on the 27th of February. Check in time is 3pm and we were greeted in a friendly manner on arrival. We had pre booked car space and were provided with free parking in the Hotels private car park which is just around the corner.
