Pre booking is advisable as parking in this area of Dublin is expensive. The room we stayed in was quite large and accessible by elevator to the 5th floor. All necessary amenities are available in the on suite room and the only complaint rests on the curtains and the TV. The curtains were not wide enough for the window and the  blind was damaged so no closure possible. We were on the 5th floor so could not be overlooked but the curtains and blind should not have been so shabby. The TV channels were not set properly and we had…

title: 2nd visit
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel- we are always delighted to receive feedback from our guests. It was a real pleasure to be able to welcome you to the Drury Court, and to be able to provide you with one of our onsite parking spots. We are also glad to hear that you found our front desk staff so helpful and friendly- we shall certainly pass this on to the team here, as we really pride ourselves on our customer service. We sincerely apologise for the small problems that you have mentioned during your stay but thank you for bringing them to our attention. We have included a check of the television channels in the housekeeping duties, which should resolve this issue for future guests. Furthermore, as part of our recent refurbishment, we have altered the curtains on the fifth floor in particular. These curtains have now been replaced by blackout blinds, that cover the entire window, ensuring a more peaceful night's sleep in our hotel.  We would love to welcome you back to the Drury Court Hotel in the future, please contact reception directly on +35314751988 to avail of your return guest discount and to reserve your onsite parking once more.  We look forward to hearing from you, Kindest regards, Emma

title: Ideal location, great stays!
review: Went here last January and decided to return again.it's a central hotel 5 mins from temple bar and very good value at only 46 a night room only for the two of us. We had room 207 and it was comfy with a spacious bathroom,Lots of hot water and a warm room with comfy beds. Would definitely go back to this hotel it's comfy,central and reasonably priced

title: New Years Break..
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We really value all guest feedback, especially from our returning guests, as we are always looking to update the services we provide. We are delighted to learn that you found our hotel good value, comfy and spacious.  It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel for the second time, and we do hope that you will return in the future. Please contact reception directly via telephone (+35314751988) or via email (reservations@drurycourthotel.ie) to avail of your return guest discount off any further bookings.  Kindest regards, Emma

title: Perfect for Family with 2 teenager daughters
review: I regularly use the Drury Court Hotel for business and sometimes leisure and cannot find fault with anything.  Sure it is slightly (only slightly) dated but the rooms are spotless and the staff are excellent and cant do enough.  The improvement of sound barriers to the windows has improved sleep quality significatly.  The changes to the bar have made it more lively (if you like lively) and the food is always excellent.

title: Good Location
review: We chose to stay here as we were going out for dinner with friends. The price was really good for the location and that made us pick it out. The downsides - despite it having "free wifi", we couldn't get on it at all (2 x iPhones and an iPad). Maybe it was because we were on the top floor. The room was a little shabby - stained carpets and the curtains didn't hang straight down as the wall curved inwards (not good at avoiding morning daylight). The shower was a little underpowered. The good bits - great location for the centre. Great price that would have been the same price as a taxi home, so a no-brainer. We'd stay again for the above points.

title: Really good value for a central hotel in Dublin
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your comments about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We really welcome all feedback, both positive and negative, as we are constantly looking to update the service we provide to our guests. We are very sorry to hear that the WiFi was unreliable during your stay, we are currently in the process of changing our provider to ensure a faster service throughout the hotel. We have also taken on board your comments regarding the decor, and shall look to update this in the near future.  We are delighted to hear that you found our location so convenient, and would love to welcome you back for a second stay with us. If you would like to be in touch with us directly for any future bookings, we shall be sure to offer you the return guest discount. Best, David Cahill

title: Good 3 Star Hotel in a Great Location
review: Great hotel that I would definitely use again. Great location, nice rooms and very good value. Staff also very helpful and ultimately a really good experience. Limited parking, but you can get discount at a public car park that is fairly close.

title: Great location, clean hotel, noisy.
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we really value all customer feedback. We were delighted to read that you found our location so convenient, and the rooms to be good value. We shall also be sure to pass on your kind comments about our friendly staff.  We would love to welcome you back in the future; please contact our reception directly and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount as well as one of our limited onsite parking spaces.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Great location
review: Stayed here for 3 nights and it really is in a great location, step out the door and walk any direction will bring you too an endless number of shops , restaurants , bars and tourist attractions. From the hotel a 10/15 minute walk will bring you to the centre of Templebar , O Connell St , Grafton St , Stephens Green ( Green Luas Line ) and Dame St ( Hop on Hop off bus stop ) . We had a comfortable if basic clean room on the 4th floor to the rear of the hotel , no views but that would be  expected in the city centre.Room had a double and single bed so plenty of room for luggage etc.Free wi fi with good reception , tea / coffee facilities, trouser press, flat screen tv , good quality bed linen ,plenty of fresh towels and toiletries provided and excellent shower pressure. The only…

title: Good location, old hotel
review: The location is very good with complimentary parking. The reception staff and hotel staff are very polite and accommodating. However the rooms leave a lot to be desired. They are small, very old and run down. They could really do with a refurbishment, especially for the price we paid. We spent very little time in our room which was just as well as it was very dull and dreary. It is beyond me why in this day and age some hotels still have shower curtains. Overall the hotels location and staff make up for the shortcoming's in the rooms decor.

title: Convenient, Clean, Comfortable and Affordable
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We really welcome all customer feedback, both positive and negative, as we are constantly looking to update the service we provide. We have taken your comments regarding the decor of the hotel on board, and shall certainly address these in the near future. We were, however, delighted to hear that you considered the location to be so convenient and that you found our staff to be helpful and friendly, as customer service is a real priority.  We would be delighted to welcome you back in the future; if you would like to make a return booking, please contact reception directly to avail of the return guest discount. Best, David Cahill

title: Exellent service
review: We stayed 2 separate times at the Drury Court during our trip to Ireland. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Both rooms were clean, comfortable, quiet for sleeping and affordable. (The only thing I would have missed is a hairdryer had I not brought one myself.) The hotel is convenient to popular tourist sites, local transportation and the Dublin Tourist Center, which is the pickup point for most day tours. Also convenient to many restaurants, bars and shopping. A big plus - we needed a laundry that would wash our clothes while we toured and were referred to a convenient laundrette right around the corner - same day service. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a convenient good value accommodation.

title: well located hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel.  We really value all customer feedback as we aim to constantly update the service we provide.  We are delighted to learn that you found our central location so handy for visiting the many tourist sites, shops and restaurants that Dublin has to offer. We shall also pass on your kind comments about our friendly staff to the team here.   It was a real pleasure to welcome you to our hotel on this occasion; if you do make a return visit to Dublin in the future, please contact reception directly to receive a discount off your next booking. Best, David Cahill

title: Good service, convenient
review: We found the Drury Court Hotel to be very good with very friendly staff. Our room was spacious, very comfortable and clean. When we arrived we were met by very friendly and professional reception staff. They offered us free car park space, which is very unusual for Dublin hotel. We had a few drinks in the bar before exploring the streets around hotel, which had large number bars and restaurants, offering excellent value. While our room was at the front of hotel there was absolutely no noise coming from the street. Our breakfast the following Morning was excellent. Thanks to David (General Manager) and his professional Team. We will definitely be back again. Garvan and Mairead

title: Comfortable stay in excellent location
review: We stayed here with the car recently and made use of the hotel's own car park which we were able to book in advance at no extra charge.  The room was large, clean and comfortable and we were able to check in early which was a bonus for us.  We managed to get a deal on line which included continental breakfast which was more than adequate for our needs.  It was wonderful to have everything we wanted to see within easy walking distance.  A lucky find for us!!

title: Location makes it worth consideration
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. It was a pleasure to be able to assist you with the early check in and car parking during your stay, and we are delighted to hear that you found your room large and comfortable. We do hope that you enjoyed your time in Dublin and were able to visit lots of sites from our central location. If you return to Dublin in the future, please contact us directly at reception so that we can offer you the return guest discount.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: A pleasant surprise...
review: This hotel is a couple of blocks from Grafton St. and St. Stephen's Green so it worked out very well for a couple of days sightseeing in Dublin.  It is not a modern hotel but our room was large and clean although somewhat noisy facing a very busy side street.  More than adequate breakfast in a "temporary" basement location and helpful front desk staff. Very good value and no major complaints.

title: Budget hotel in great location!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to learn that you found our central location so convenient, and that you were able to visit the many tourist attractions in the local area.  We do hope that you were not overly inconvenienced by the outside noise- if you make a return visit, we would be glad to give you a room on a high floor to alleviate this.  If you are in Dublin in the future, we would love to welcome you back; please contact our reception team for any future bookings to avail of your return guest discount.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Nice location, but not as nice as we expected.
review: This very central hotel wasn't on my radar til now. There are cheaper but for the €109 I paid (inc. breakfast) I'm very pleased with my stay here.   Check in was friendly. Staff were very helpful to some tourists. The room was amply appointed and clean. Proper toiletries provided. Breakfast was fine too.  Good job.

title: Our 1st Trip to Ireland
review: Arrived in Ireland for a 7 week vacation, 12 days in Ireland, 12 in Scotland and balance in Paris. Several rounds of golf scheduled. Picked up our Hertz rental car with no problem, Found the hotel with our GPS  Our flight landed at 5:30 a.m. Hotel room not ready but they stored our luggage.  Later that day we checked in..........room was comfortable and a very convenient location.  Only problem, when the bars close at night,  you can expect about 2 hours of screaming, loud music and NO SLEEP.  Suggested to the desk clerk that they should call the police........said he would, noise continued each night. Breakfast was nice, friendly service and plenty of choices.

title: Abruptly Awakened by Aggressive Banging of Door in Middle of Night
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience at the Drury Court Hotel.  It was a pleasure to be able to assist you with luggage storage on arrival whilst you enjoyed your first day in Dublin. We are delighted to learn that you found our rooms so comfortable and our breakfast staff so friendly, we shall certainly pass this on to our team here.  We do apologise that your sleep was disrupted by external noise- it was an uncommonly busy weekend in the city centre, meaning that we were unfortunately unable to control the noise levels on this occasion. If you do make a return visit to us, please do not hesitate to request a room on a higher floor at the back of the hotel, as this should alleviate most of the problem. We would be very glad to welcome you back in the future; please contact us directly at reception to avail of your return guest discount.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Excellent location - clean and friendly !
review: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel.The receptionist was friendly and helpful. The lift had been modernised and improved efficiency.  On entering the room we noticed there was some renovation done since we last stayed a couple of years ago. The windows were changed to new double windows.The curtains also closed perfectly. The twin beds were comfortable.  However the room had no air-condition and it was rather hot and traffic noise almost the whole night when we had no choice but to open the window for some fresh air. The next day we made a complaint and the guy at the reception promptly brought in a standing fan which made our sleep a tad better.  However, there was absolutely no improvement in the sound proof of the room, where the closing of doors of neighbouring rooms were…

title: Very Good Location
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to review your stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are constantly trying to improve the service we provide to guests, as you kindly noted with your comments about our recent renovations, and so all feedback is welcomed.  We were delighted to read that you were able to take advantage of our new mattresses, triple glazing and lift, as these have all been replaced within the last year. It was also good to read that we were able to assist you with the provision of a fan during your stay. However we are sorry to read that your sleep was disturbed by the banging of a neighbouring door; the vast majority of our guests are extremely respectful to others, so this is surprising. We do hope that you contacted our 24 hour reception to assist with this disturbance. We shall certainly take all of your comments on board, and hope to be able to welcome you again in the future. Please contact our reservations team directly to avail of your return guest discount.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Great Location
review: We had a lovely one week stay at The Drury Court Hotel.  We had a couple of minor issues with the room that were dealt with quickly and helpfully by the staff.  We really enjoyed eating at Fallon and Byrne - 2 mins from the hotel.

title: Average Hotel in downtown Dublin!
review: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel.  The Hotel location is what makes this hotel worth the high price. It is centrally located and an easy walk to everything in Dublin.  The interior of the hotel is outdated and our room had a musty smell with old cosmetics and an old mattress.  We were glad they let us check in early.  The staff was hit or miss on their friendliness.  Most times we felt they didn't care about us a bit when we had a question or asked for advice.  The internet is very inconsistent as well and didn't work most the time.

title: Above average location, some shortcomings
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to hear that you found our central location so convenient, and we do hope you were able to sample plenty of the attractions and eateries in our surrounding area.  We are sorry that you experienced issues with the internet during your stay- we have since had these addressed by our technical support team to ensure they are fully resolved for the future. We are, however, surprised to learn that you found our staff to be hit or miss, as this is certainly not the standard we aspire to, nor usually achieve.  We would certainly be delighted to welcome you back in the future to show you the level of service we are able to provide. If you do visit Dublin again, please do not hesitate to be in touch with us directly to avail of your return guest discount.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Centrally located quality hotel
review: Stayed for a long weekend after a 5-day brewery excursion. Stayed on 4th floor of 5 with two twin beds. No room safe, UK-style AC outlets, large closet with spare comforters but only four hangers (more supplied upon request). Large, soft cotton bath towels. Bathroon with no ceiling fan. Beds were average and there was no noticable room-to-room noise. Didn't  try (wake up for) breakfast.  TV with few stations and some commercial radio stations. Some alley noise when adjacent bars empy billions of glass bottles at 7 am. And beer keg delivers g=begin at 7:30. No airconditioning so open windows for sooler air also let in alley noise. Tiny lobby has pay-as-you-go PC for Internet access. Room WiFi was completely unreliable.  Accalimed Bia Bar on ground flloor was closed beginning…

title: Helpful Staff
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to review your recent experience with us. We welcome all feedback, both positive and negative as we are constantly attempting to improve the service we provide. We do apologise for the issues you experienced with the WiFi during your visit; these have since been resolved so that a reliable connection is accessible throughout the entire hotel. Furthermore, if you were to return to the hotel in the future during similarly warm temperatures, we would be delighted to provide you with a fan in the room to hopefully combat both the warmth and external noise issues you mentioned. We are delighted to learn that you found our central location so convenient, and our staff so friendly- we shall certainly pass your kind comments on to the team here.  We would love the opportunity to welcome you back for a second visit, especially now that the renovations are complete in the adjacent bar. Please be in touch with us directly to avail of your return guest discount off any future booking.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Exceptional Staff
review: We stayed at Drury Ct for three nights in early September.... hotel was as expected..... excellent central location a few minutes walk from Trinity College, Grafton Street, Temple Bar district,St Stephen's Green ,....   Rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean....  Check in is 3:00 PM so don't be surprised when you arrive after a long trans-Atlantic flight....  Did not try the breakfast but the Metro Cafe and Butler's Chocolate Cafe are excellent within 2 blocks.  The Hairy Lemon pub across the street is a superb restaurant disguised as a pub.  Highly reccomend it.

title: more than a good location
review: I like this place very much. Staff friendly and management is top class.  I had an excellent room. Breakfast was ok with a nice choice to eat indoors or outside- now that is nice. Carparking is excellent. On leaving, I was told what I should "demand" on my next trip; this is what i call doing good business for hotel and customer. I need hardly tell you that I plan to return

title: Great location, lovely staff
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are always updating the service that we provide, so customer feedback is really appreciated. We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed your stay at the Drury Court Hotel, and shall certainly pass on your comments about our staff to the team, both in the breakfast area and the hotel. It was also a pleasure to be able to give you one of our onsite parking spaces during your stay.  As we mentioned on checkout, we would be glad to welcome you back in the future and offer you the return guest discount if you book directly. We look forward to hearing from you. Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Perfect location
review: Perfect location, very clean and reasonably appointed rooms. The price was right !!!! And the breakfast was a great, classic Irish breakfast. We could walk any and everywhere from there.  The staff was nice and helpful, and very accommodating when it came to getting our rooms suitable for the number of people in our group. Internet worked fine. A/C worked. Absolutely no complaints. Recommended hotel.

title: Very Pleased
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to learn that you thought your stay was good value and found our central location very convenient. We shall also be sure to pass on your kind remarks about our friendly staff to the team here, as we pride ourselves on our customer service. We do hope you enjoyed your time in Ireland and would love to welcome you back in the future if you are in Dublin again.   Best, David Cahill

title: Great location in the heart of Dublin
review: Stayed in an apartment here for 2 nights on a hen weekend. Fantastic location- near the shops and lots of nice cafes and bars within walking distance. Easy walking distance to temple bar too. Good sized rooms, towels and toiletries supplied. Couldn't have asked for better!

title: Very happy with my stay
review: I stayed here for two nights while stopping in Dublin before heading west.  The hotel is in a great location, I was jet lagged and not feeling 100% so I came back the my room to regroup 3 times during my day of exploring Dublin, it's so central.  I had a room with a full size bed, it was about half the size of a hotel room in the states, but was very clean and comfortable.  I was on the 3rd floor, and the music from the pub across the street was pretty loud when I had the window open, but very quiet once I closed both sets of windows (they have extra interior windows which really cut the sound).  The wifi was free and fast, which I have come to truly appreciate after staying in way too many places (Hilton!) where I've paid $10 per device for basically dial up.

title: Nice hotel, friendly staff
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for your kind comments about your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to relax after a long flight. We hope you managed to explore many of Dublin's attractions from our central location before you continued to the West of Ireland.   If you do make a return visit to Dublin, we would be delighted to welcome you back and offer you the return guest discount. Please contact reception directly in order to avail of this. Best, David Cahill

title: Location is key to this hotel
review: Great location, busy weekend, staff excellent, especially David the Manager. Car parking sorted out with minimum fuss. handing out directions and friendly chat from all the staff. Triple glazing helped with noise. It would be beneficial to book your parking space before you travel.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel.  We were delighted to hear that you found our staff so friendly and it was a pleasure to be able to assist you personally during your stay here. We are also very glad to hear that you enjoyed a peaceful stay as a result of the triple glazing.   Please do not hesitate to be in contact with us on any return visit and we shall of course offer you the return guest discount. We look forward to welcoming you back again, Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: The Location is great.
review: The hotel is in a really good location for tourists.  It is within walking distance of a number of Dublin sites (Trinity College, Grafton Street, museums, Temple Bar area, etc.).  It's also close to a Wagamama (yeah!) and a TGI Friday's (not what I wanted to see on an Irish vacation).  It's only a few blocks away from a bus stop that you can take to/from airport.  Just use Google Maps to look at Street View to get your bearings on the way to walk to the hotel.  I was wandering around on a Sunday morning looking for the place.  Dublin streets aren't on a grid system!  The room was clean, and for Europe the room was good sized.  Bed was a little hard.  Lots of closet space. It faced the street and there was street noise, especially in the morning.  Two complaints.  First, not…

title: London Jackeen
review: The Drury Court is probably in the best location for a weekend visit to Dublin. Situated at the top of Grafton street is located amongst some of the best pubs, cafes and restaurants on offer.  The room was basic and very clean, perfect for our needs. The street below was a bit noisy at night but this did not bother us too much.

title: Worth a visit
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your kind comments regarding your stay at the Drury Court Hotel. As we are so centrally located, we are very glad to hear that you found the location ideal for visiting the attractions and restaurants Dublin has to offer. We do hope you enjoyed your time in Dublin and hopefully we shall have the opportunity to welcome you back for a second visit to the Drury Court Hotel. Please contact the hotel directly for any future bookings to avail of our return guest discount.  Kind regards, David Cahill

title: Shocking - don't stay in their apartments
review: Excellent location, attended a function there, staff were very friendly and genuinely cared in particular Paul who resolved an error I had made. I would recommend the Drury Court Hotel for all for their attentive and warm service.

title: Great location, quiet in back rooms, excellent Cust Service.
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to learn that you found our staff friendly and helpful, as we really pride ourselves on our customer service. We shall pass these comments on to all of our team here.  It was a pleasure to welcome you to the Drury Court during your time in Dublin and we hope to see you again in the future. Please contact us directly for any return booking and we shall ensure you receive our return guest discount.  Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Excellent Location/Excellent Value/
review: My husband and I recently stayed in apartment 43 of this hotel and it was very disappointing to say the least.  Shortly after surveying our room/ apartment my husband phoned reception to ask if we could leave but were told that as we had prepaid we would not be refunded! The apartment was very shabby - shower was broken - bracket broken off the wall & actual electric shower unit broken, mould on shower screen, lounge curtains hanging off hooks, badly matched furniture, broken lamps, burn mark on bedside unit etc. etc.  I don't know if these apartments are leased out to the Drury court or owned by them but never the less they are shabby & badly neglected and don't give the hotel a good impression.   The staff were friendly, but a bit inexperienced.  We travel to Dublin often &…

title: VERY Large room, excellent location, good value.
review: My wife and I stayed here our last 3 nights in the UK of a two week holiday and couldn't have been happier with the hotel. The room was large, the facilities clean and well organized. The bar downstairs served wonderful breakfast, and even better drinks. Temple Bar is WELL within walking distance, and even the Jameson and Guiness facilities are a generous walk away. The room was quiet, and we were lucky enough to get to park for free our 2nd and 3rd evenings. The hotel has limited parking, but if you ask and a spot opens they will hold it for you.

title: Decent weekend city stay
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking the time to let us know about your experience at the Drury Court Hotel. We are delighted to hear that you found the location so convenient and the rooms large, and that you enjoyed your stay with us. It was a pleasure to be able to help you with our onsite car parking, if you do make a return visit with us, we could allocate one of these spaces for the duration of your stay in advance. We very much hope to see you again in the future; please do not hesitate to be in touch with us directly to avail of the return guest discount. Kindest regards,  David Cahill

title: excellent choice, best location!
review: First night - room was extremely warm but as it was a fri night the hotel bar entertainment noise meant we couldn't keep the window open.  Twin room (2 beds - bigger than singles, which was great), was spacious, had adequate facilities (no biscuits for tea and coffee!!) Breakfast was good. Staff very helpfuul and pleasant.  Only problem was access to wifi from an apple device! The free wifi is great however i was not told that in order to use the internet on my iphone, i had to go to a specific web link to log in. I only discovered this on leaving as other guests were enquiring about it. I thought the problem lay with my own phone. Was very disappointed to not have use of the free wifi advertised as i tried constantly since arriving. i hope the hotel take my advice about…

title: Great location, Good Value
review: Dear Guest,  Many thanks for posting your views of your recent stay with us – we welcome all comments and suggestions as we are constantly updating the service we provide to our guests. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your time with us on the whole, and shall certainly try to better notify guests of the Wi-Fi connection process. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future; please be in touch with us directly at reception to avail of the return guest discount. Best, David Cahill

title: This is our new home in Dublin!
review: We were told by Dubliners to stay in south Dublin, so it was all about LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION for us.....we found the perfect location with the Drury Court Hotel.  We were steps to Powerscourt (shopping & JIG), Trinity College (The Book of Kells) Grafton Street & St. Stephen's Green. We were also a quick walk to the Temple Bar Area....and I was so glad that we were NOT staying in Temple Bar (it reminded me of Paris' Latin Quarter).   Our hotel was quiet.  The staff was helpful, kind and very attentive.  The Bia Bar served the included breakfast which was fine.  The staff at the Bia were also very accommodating making their special of the previous day on the following day per my request..... Our only complaint was there was a heating pump or something that ran up the side…

title: Good value, central location
review: Dear Guest, We are so delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and managed to see a number of sights and attractions in the city centre during your time in Dublin. Thank you very much for your kind comments regarding our staff both in the hotel and in the Bia Bar, we shall certainly ensure these are passed on to the team here. We do apologise for the inconvenience you experienced with the heating pump outside your room; our maintenance team has ensured that this issue has now been fully resolved.  We do look forward to welcoming you back for a second visit with us, Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Location & Service!
review: This is a well situated, basic hotel. It's an easy walk to all the key Dublin sights. No frills or charm but very good value for the money.  Breakfast was included in our rate, which was convenient and basic. Quite helpful staff, would stay here again.

title: Great value for money
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your kind comments regarding your time at the Drury Court Hotel. We are glad to read that you found our location convenient and considered your stay to be good value.  We do hope you enjoyed your vacation in Dublin and managed to see all the sights the city has to offer. If you make a return visit, please be in touch with us directly and we would be delighted to offer you the return guest discount. Best,  David Cahill

title: Great value, location and quality
review: We arrived to the Hotel at 10am in hopes of an early check in so we could freshen up from our long flight. Check out is not until noon so we knew there was a chance they could not get us in. The young lady at the front desk checked if our room was ready but it was not. She felt bad knowing the long flight we had so she offered us a complimentary coffee at the Bia Bar. This was so very much appreciated! About an hour later my wife checked to see if we could possibly get in and to our surprise or room was ready! This was such a relief considering we had a full day ahead of us.  We arrived to room 305 and we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious and had all of the amenities we needed. We did have to call for an iron and iron board but they were brought to the…

title: lost laundry
review: I spent 5 nights at the Drury Court.  I  would have rated it an average hotel, spartan but clean and safe.  However this was my experience.  I had entrusted  to them 4 days of laundry  and it was lost or thrown away.  While they admitted total responsibility for the loss, the compensation did not cover the cost of undergarments.  I was traveling with a carry on only, and did not have a lot of clothing options. I spent approximately 250 Euro to replace basic items and was compensated 80 Euro.  I submitted receipts but get not response.

title: Very good location, clean and nice.
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to review your time at the Drury Court Hotel. We understand that you experienced some inconvenience regarding the laundry service at our hotel, and once again we can only apologise for this.  This matter has been followed up with you personally, and we do hope that you would now consider the matter resolved. This is certainly not the level of service we aim to provide, nor normally achieve, and we would be delighted to welcome you back in the future to redress the negative impression you received on this occasion. Very best regards, David Cahill

title: Thank You!
review: Good value, location, location, location. You are close to "everything", The room were larger than expected. staff very friendly Stayed there 4 nights in may,and had the pleasure watching Eric Clapton at The O2.

title: Great central hotel
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for taking the time to review the Drury Court Hotel, we are glad to hear that you enjoyed your time in Dublin and at Eric Clapton.  It was a pleasure to welcome you to our hotel, and we shall pass on your kind feedback to all of the staff. If you are in Dublin again in the future, please contact us directly and we shall ensure you receive our return guest discount on your next booking. Warmest regards, David Cahill

title: Nice Central Location
review: Great hotel in a central location.  My friend and I stayed here while attending a concert in the Olympia Theatre and the hotel is walking distance from the venue with very reasonable room rates and ever helpful staff.  Big shout out to Emma who nice enough to post me back my wallet, which I had misplaced in a taxi! :-)

title: Great Dublin Hotel
review: What can I say - great hotel, great price and great location. Clean, modern and extremely comfortable hotel. We stayed in room 401 and room was huge. Staff very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. Right on the door step of Temple Bar area but far enough away not to be kept awake with all the loud music. We paid £84 for room and full Irish breakfast for the 2 of us through Travel Republic. Absolute bargain and a must if you want a good decent hotel in Dublin!

title: Good location
review: Dear Guest, Many thanks for your kind review of your stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we are very glad you enjoyed your time with us and really value guest feedback. It was wonderful to read that you found our rooms clean and modern, as we have recently completed a number of renovations within the hotel. We shall also ensure your comments about our friendly staff are passed on to the team here.  We hope to welcome you back again in the future; please be in touch with us at reception to avail of the return guest discount. Kindest regards, David Cahill

title: Great base camp
review: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The room was much larger than I expected and very clean. The staff seemed to be sincerely interested in making  sure the quests were happy. The hotel is in a very good location and many of the tourist sites are within easy walking distance.  There's  a nice selection of restaurants, Pubs and shopping areas close to the hotel. Also, a pickup point for the Hop On-Hop Off Tour is only about two blocks away

title: Good location for exploring Dublin
review: Dear Guest, Many thanks for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We are glad that you enjoyed not only our convenient location but also the cleanliness of our rooms. I am glad our friendly staff were able to make your stay here with us more pleasurable, and shall pass on your comments to the team here.  We would love the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and look forward to hearing from you, Warmest regards,  David Cahill

title: Excellent Location - Great Team
review: Feels more like a motel than hotel. Very nice staff. Rooms average standard. A very central location if staying in Dublin. You are in Temple Bar. Close to all concert venues. And it's easy to get out of the city from here.

title: Will definitely stay again!
review: Was really happy with this hotel....I had a really early arrival into the airport and arrived at the hotel at 10.45am asking if I could leave my bag there for the day until check-in. I was informed that my room was ready and I could go straight there! What a relief, as I had been up since 3am so I went to my room for a 3 hour nap!! The room was perfectly adequate, the only disturbance during the night being from the elephants running up and down the corridor and slamming doors. I did wake up also due to being too cold but the radiator was adjustable. I wasn't informed of breakfast even though when I booked it I was told there was a free breakfast, so I can't comment on this.  Excellent location being at the bottom of Grafton Street. Just watch the taxis, I was charged 13 euros…

title: very nice hotel and friendly staff
review: Dear Guest, Many thanks for your kind review of your stay at the Drury Court Hotel; we are very glad you enjoyed your time with us and we were able to help you check in early. We shall ensure your comments about our friendly staff are passed on to the team here, and hope to welcome you back again in the future. If you would like to contact reception directly, we shall be delighted to offer you the return guest discount and also assist with any questions regarding the breakfast. Kindest regards, David Cahill	 General Manager

title: Dublin is great for walking
review: the hotel was very nce and in a very good location. It is very close to the city centre. We had booked triple room and it was large and convinient for 3. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good enough.The bia bar is a very nice place for a relaxing coffee.

title: will def stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: Dear Guest, Thank you very much for your kind comments regarding your recent stay at the Drury Court Hotel and the attached Bia Bar; we are delighted that you enjoyed your time with us and found the location so convenient. We shall also ensure your comments regarding our friendly staff are passed on to all of our team here.  We would love the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and look forward to hearing from you again, David Cahill

title: Great location and fantastic staff
review: Hotel is nicely located v central making Dublin easily walkable and pleasant. Car parking available but do check. Breakfast was the worst aspect and is not to be recommended unless you are realty stuck and prefer the convenience. Variable everyday yet its the same basic fare. also terrible was the room lighting hopeless for night reading. Otherwise superbly friendly hard working staff keep this place going. Very good sized rooms n bathroom with plenty of hot water for baths with only one ceiling light. Very warm rooms and well double glazed from street noises which is just as well as digging up main roads outside was frequent during my stay starting at 6 pmish till very late. Tv ok although I had to ask for retune so as to get what is says is offered.

title: Absolutely fantastic hotel
review: The location is incredible in the dead center of Dublin. It is a short walk away from the major sites to see in Dublin. The staff was extremely helpful and I was incredibly impressed with how cheap the hotel really was. Not only that, but your room key is good for a discount the next time you stay there so it is highly recommended to stay there any time you are in Dublin. Definitely a place you must stay in.

title: Birthday Break
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel in the heart of Dublin City. Thank you for your kind comments regarding our staff. I will be sure to pass them directly onto the team. I hope to welcome you back soon. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: quality and value
review: Good clean hotel with excellent staff. Centrally positioned. The rooms are large enough and comfortable with all the amenities you require for a pleasant stay. Couple be a little noisy if you don't close the double glazing. Breakfasts good and all the coffee you want. Staff here could not be more helpful. When I'm back in Dublin this place will be used again.

title: Great Hotel
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel in the heart of Dublin City. I am glad you enjoyed our large, comfortable rooms and found our breakfast tasty. Thank you also for your kind comments regarding our staff. Regarding the noise, we have recently intalled triple glazing to resolve this issue. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: A good hotel in a great location
review: Have stayed at Drury Court several times now - always of a high standard and reasonable price. Excellent location, great staff, comfortable rooms - to be recommended! Will certainly return later this year.

title: Excellent Choice for City Centre Night Out
review: I have stayed here twice during nights out and have not been disappointed.  It is a short stroll to Grafton Street area, you have pubs, restaurants and theatres literally on the doorstep.  i liked this hotel as its quiet, comfortable and clean.  The rates were excellent €78 for a triple room!! Our last stay was mid January.  The lift was broken but we were offered help with our bags.  Room was on top floor so i requested a lower floor and that was no problem.  The room was clean, as was the bathroom, and beds very comfortable.  I would highly recommend.

title: A night in Dublin
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel in the heart of Dublin City. We are indeed centrally located, and I am glad you had the chance to explore most of Dublin's near by attractions by foot, as this is the best way to experience the city.I am pleased you found our rooms to be quiet, comfortabe and clean. We were pleased to announce recently that our lift has been fully upgraded and is now fully operational. Our rooms have also been recently been upgraded with triple glazed windows. I hope you had the chance to use our free-wifi, avialable in all the rooms. I look forward to welcoming you back for a second visit. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: " I made a good choice to come here"
review: This hotel is located in the heart of Dublin city (and a very good/quite area).  I had booked a number of rooms for a family dinner in Dublin and the rates were excellent value. On the day the lift was broken but staff were on hand to carry bags if required. Rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. Great location for all types of breaks, be it shopping, party or tourism.

title: Perfect location and staff! One or two minor niggles
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel in the heart of Dublin City. I look forward to welcoming you back for a second visit. I am pleased you found our rooms clean and comfortabe. We are pleased to announce all rooms now have triple glazed windows We were also pleased to announce recently that our lift has been fully upgraded and is now fully operational. I am glad you were able to take advantage of our central location. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: A couple of days in Dublin
review: Other reviews persuaded me and my party to come here-we were not disappointed. Didnt arrive till approx midnight and heating in one room was faulty but call to reception got quick response and fault was rectified. Very well positioned for access to Temple Bar and city attractions. Not too far to walk to get to a stop on the On-Off bus service which I would highly recommend for first time visitors like ourselves. Staff very customer friendly and breakfasts served very quickly although I thought the Full Irish breakfast could have been Fuller. Good choice and no regrets.

title: great value central hotel
review: this hotel is 5 minutes from temple bar and trinity college it's really central and within walking distance to most of the attractions.we dropped off our bags at the hotel at 10am and these were ticketed an  put behind reception. we returned at 5pm to check in (check in is 3pm) and check in was speedy.we got the lift to floor three and it seemed to drop then we were stuck for a few minutes which was pretty scary we pressed the alarm a few times and the lift started again. we never got back in the lift instead taking the stairs. our room 301 was spacious and we were quite impressed as we only paid 86 euros for 2 nights. we did not spend  a lot of time in our room as we were busy sight seeing but it was ideal. a lovely big bathroom with lots of hot water. we liked the teas and…

title: Great location
review: Dear Guest, It was a pleasure to read your overall enjoyment of our centrally located hotel. I will pass your positive feedback onto all the team. In relation to the elevator we have just completed a major refurbishment of both the lift and secondary internal glazing in all of the bedrooms. It appears the incident was an isolated teething problem which has now been corrected. Thank  you for your feedback and we look forward to welcoming back in the future. Kind Regards, David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Great hotel Would Return.
review: A good hotel at a reasonable price. A great location for access to the city centre. The hotel is clean, comfortable and offers a good breakfast. My room was on the 5th floor and was spacious clean and had comfy beds. The bar in the hotel seems to be good and busy but didn't get a chance to enjoy it. Very handy to access the beautiful St. Stephens Green.

title: noise no longer an issue
review: Dear Guest, We are delighted to read of your appreciation for the new matress, the location, room cleanliness and the breakfast. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future. Kind Regards, David Cahill.

title: Perfect for a city break
review: This is a lovely hotel with good size rooms. Good bar to have a drink in the evening and lovely cooked breakfast in the mornings, staff are also pleasant and friendly.   Good location in Dublin, highly recommended.

title: Great apartment for families
review: We stayed in Drury Court's 3 bedroomed apartment which is adjacent to the hotel. Fantastic location, spacious and great value for money for a family of 6. The welcome was warm and car-parking was free. We will definitely return!

title: Would stay here again!!
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel in the heart of Dublin City. I look forward to welcoming you back for a second visit. I am happy you had the chance to experience the famous Irish hospitality first hand. We are indeed centrally located, and I am glad you had the chance to explore most of Dublin's attractions by foot, as this is the best way to experience the city. Thank you for your kind words regarding our reception team and I will pass your comments directly on to the team. We are glad we could accomodate your family in our apartment and in the carpark at the back of the hotel.  Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: We will be back
review: I booked the hotel on line, with breakfast included.  Hotel is in a great location, near grafton st & temple bar. Great pub opposite, the hairy lemon make sure you visit.  Rooms are big, clean & comfortable. Lifts not working, but the front desk staff were very apologetic. Breakfast was nice, the full Irish was a bit small, would be my only gripe! Would stay here again.

title: Perfect location
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel in the heart of Dublin City. I look forward to welcoming you back for a second visit. We are indeed centrally located, and I am glad you had the chance to explore most of Dublin's attractions by foot, as this is the best way to experience the city.I am pleased you enjoyed our spacious rooms and found them comfortabe. Thank you for your kind words regarding our reception team and I will pass your comments directly on to the team. We are pleased to announce our lift is now fully upgraded and fully operational. Our breakfast is very tasty and I hope that you had an opportunity to try our continental breakfast offering, which includes an array of Italian hams, continental cheese and fresh fruits and cereals. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Excellent location, nice room
review: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel this week and are both delighted to have found a centrally located hotel at a reasonable price. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was exceptional. The lift was out of order but two staff members gladly grabbed our bags and carried them to the fifth floor. We are thrilled to have found such a gem!

title: Excellent Value and great location
review: Really good value - nice and clean, good location.  Had read so many horror stories of being kept awake by noisy drinkers .... Not here..... Quiet back street but literally just a short walk from plenty of shops and attractions and only just off the bus route.  A great find.  Had a slight problem with a broken toilet as, which sadly was not rectified .....otherwise would thoroughly recommend.

title: Fair location, staff rude & not fit to be in the hospitality business.
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here in the heart of Dublin City. I am glad you had no problems with noise. We are pleased to announce we have recently installed triple glazed windows in all the rooms. I am glad you enjoyed your stay here with us and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future. Kind Regards, David Cahill General Manager

title: lovely hotel.
review: The manager was curt, the staff members were not spontaneous or welcoming, plus the rooms are very average. Not recommended.   When i went there, we had a lot of bags and the staff told us to put them behind the reception desk after notifying us that the rooms will only be ready by 2,3, or 4pm. There were tons of other bags and not enough room for walking. No proper storage, porter service, or concierge. They didn't even label the bags and other visitors could have just taken our bags while taking their own bags.   Taking the elevator was also a very scary experience.

title: Fantastic location and staff
review: Dear Katerina, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your experience. It's unfortunate that you didn’t bring this to my attention during your stay and I would have been happy to respond. These are not the standards we aspire too or, achieve on the whole, for the majority of our guests. In relation to luggage we do indeed have labels and have an impeccable record with our guests’ luggage. As a 3 star hotel we do not generally offer porterage or concierge, however, we are currently offering this service because we are upgrading the lift, to address the very problem you mentioned. Thank you again. Kind Regards, David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Much better else where
review: I stayed 1 night in room 505 .The room in on the top floor overlooking the side street.The room was clean and warm .No  air conditioning, Its Ireland you need central heating and it was on.The large  en suite bathroom was spotless . Quick check in and they give you a little map of the area . One lift /elevator but I prefer to use the stairs ,all five floors . I always use the stairs in any hotel because you can tell how clean a place is by the stairs .The stairs was spotless .I didn't try the food . Would use again .

title: Perfect location to explore Dublin
review: I recently stayed at The Drury Court Hotel for one night and it was a perfect location for the event I was attending on Wexford Street.  The person at reception was very friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and very spacious and had a single and double bed in it and the bathroom was clean and spacious also had a good shower . The bed was comfy and I slept well, so all round a good stay.  The hotels location is perfect for a person on a budget and also good for a person wanting to visit and explore Dublin city.

title: Very friendly staff
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel in the heart of Dublin City. We are indeed centrally located, and I am glad you had the chance to explore most of Dublin's attractions by foot, as this is the best way to experience the city. Thank you for your kind words regarding our reception team and I will be sure to pass your comments directly on to the team. I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay and found our rooms to be clean and comfortable. I look forward to welcoming you back in the near future. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: First trip to Ireland
review: Stayed two nights in November sun,Mon got the bus from Dublin airport which stops on dame street hotel right next to temple bar drury court hotel is a few minutes walk from here . I purchased a three day rambler bus ticket  from a shop in airport costing 14 .50 euros ,it give you unlimited travel around Dublin and outskirts saving a small fortune plus you don't need to have the correct change in coins to purchase a ticket from the bus driver. The check in was very quick and smooth  I was given a room on the top floor it was a large room with two beds nice big bathroom with both shower/bath the tv had free veiw . Had breakfast each morning  full Irish very nice , the waiter refilled your coffee if you wonted . Free newspapers in breakfast lounge. Plenty of bars and resturants…

title: Good Enough
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel. We are indeed centrally located, and I am glad you had the chance to explore most of Dublin's attractions by foot, as most of the city's attrations are situated right outside our doorstep. Thank you for your positive feedback regarding our reception team and I will be sure to pass your comments directly on to the team. Our breakfast is indeed very tasty and I hope that you had an opportunity to try our continental breakfast offering, which includes an array of Italian hams, continental cheese and fresh fruits and cereals. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Great Location & Great Value for Money
review: Me and my daughter recerntley came to Dublin something we always wanted to do together,wow what a friendly and fantastic place to visit we stayed at Drury Court Hotel which made it for us the location was perfiect we walk most places on arivel and threw out the stay the reception staff were really friendly and so helpfull width every thing the hotel felt surcure and safe and to our delight the room was perfiect CLEAN and cosy we had breakfast at the hotel the staff again so friendly and couldnt do enough for us they even cooked croissants for us the same goes for the evening staff in the restruant the exsperance got 5stars from us we will deferently be back and staying at The Drury Court Hotel Rachel and Lauren Hampshire England

title: Grate hotel
review: Well checking in was a dream my room was lovely it was on the front so you did have noise ow well cant betem join them, the room was clean and tidey,we then move on to the bar well what can i say there rum is to die for the lad that sorts the rum out is grate here you pay good prices for good rum, position was fantastic come out turn right walk 100 meters across a junction there is a shoping centre and graften st walk down that to the trinity and on to o'connel st loved it

title: Excellent location
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with us, here at the Drury Court Hotel. We are indeed centrally located, and I am glad you had the chance to explore most of Dublin's attractions by foot, as most of the city's attrations are situated right outside our doorstep. We are pleased to announce that all our rooms now have triple glazed windows.  Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Great location and value
review: The hotel is located in the city centre, very near to Grafton Street. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet (at least mine was). WiFi works pretty well and is free. Staff is helpful. If you are looking for a good hotel in centre Dublin at a decent price, this is definitely the place to go.

title: Ideal location for a weekend break.
review: My fiance and I stayed here for a two night break, mid October.   After arriving in Dublin around midday, we got distracted by the hospitality of the local bar's, and didn't arrive at the hotel until later that night. This wasn't a problem for the receptionist, who happily checked us in and showed us to our room. We had booked a double, but our room had an additional single bed in, and was very spacious. Our room was located at the back of the hotel, meaning there was no road noise. The hotel was clean, but in need of some cosmetic touch ups in places. However, it still was fantastic value for money.  The location has to be the best selling point for this hotel. Grafton street shopping area, Temple Bar and all the best bars and restaurants are within ten minutes walk, and the…

title: Unhelpful staff
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience, here in the cultural quarter of Dublin city centre. I was delighted to learn of your appreciation of our happy team who lead you to your quiet, clean and spacious room. I’m glad that you felt that the central location was value for money and that overall you’ll be delighted to return. I am delighted that you’ll return and I assure you that I’ll pass your positive feedback onto the team in the meantimeThank you again for the feedback and I look forward to personally welcoming you back on your next visit.Please make sute to book directly either by phone or email to avail of a 10% discount and complimentary onsite parking. Kind Regards, David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Great location, some major issues
review: Great location however this was overshadowed by the unhelpful staff. I landed from Australia and arrived from the airport at 9am after 30 hour flight. I realised I might not be able to check in immediately however I wanted to drop off my bags as understandably had quiet a lot of luggage after returnin to Ireland after a year in Oz. I requested the hotel staff to contact me once the room was available as I was quiet jet-lagged and they informed me check in ws not till 3pm but they would call me once room was available . I have worked in hotels myself and this is quite standard request which is often done where I used to work. However this establishment made no effort to contact me despite leaving contact number with them. I returned at 2pm and asked if room was ready and was…

title: Great Location
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience with here in the heart of the city. I am sorry that we couldn’t accommodate your request for a room immediately, however, I hope that we took your luggage for storage. Upon further investigation I discovered that on the day in question we had a number of late check outs and also didn’t have the particular room type you asked for. I can only apologise for the surprise being spoiled with your sister. Your comments in relation to your requests for directions being met with “grunts” seems at odds with the consistent reviews that particularly mention the Front Desks team’s helpfulness with this but, none the less, I have passed your comments onto the team. Thank you again for taking the time to make us aware your experience and please rest assured that I will try to contact you personally to take this further and show you a more indicative experience of the hotel. Kind Regards, David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Good value and good service.
review: We are a couple in our 30s who spent 2 nights here at the start of our 7-day Ireland driving trip. Their computers were down when we arrived, and we weren't able to check in for HOURS. We were exhausted and grumpy, so we (admittedly) didn't get off to the best start with this hotel. Front desk was slightly apologetic, but seemed more concerned with fixing their issue than accommodating us. Our room could have made up for it...except it didn't. It was dark and a little shabby, with an unappealing view of another building's window. Pros of this hotel: its convenient location. Cons: almost everything else! This hotel was a good deal, but there must be better options out there.

title: Great location makes up for few flaws
review: Stayed here for a few nights in late September 2012 with several family members, totaling 3 different rooms.  This hotel is in a FANTASTIC location - just a few minutes' walk from the Cathedrals in one direction and Grafton Street in the other.  It really couldn't be more conveniently located.  Front desk staff are friendly and helpful; they were more than helpful when booking a taxi for a larger group to the airport.  Our room was very clean and tidy, and surprisingly spacious compared to other European city hotels I have stayed in.  We booked a double room and were surprised to find it actually had a double AND a twin bed, which could be helpful for families staying together.  Beds were very comfortable and linens were clean..  Spent an hour or 2 at the hotel bar on a Saturday…

title: Great Location, Good Value
review: I had read many previous reviews of the Drury Court Hotel that focused on noise issues, so I contacted them in advance via email to request a room in the back of the hotel, on a higher floor. They honored my request, we were in room 407 which was very quiet and secluded from street noise. Except for one night when there was an extremely loud party going on until 3 AM (!!) which I suspect was due to the All-Irish Hurling Championship held in Dublin earlier that day. Some rowdy Kilkenny fans celebrating :-)  We arrived very early on a Saturday morning from our trans-Atlantic flight and while we had also requested an early check-in, they were unable to help us out due to the hotel being completely booked the night before. However, they let us use a bathroom to clean up a bit and…

title: Good but noisey
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent stay with us here,  in the heart of Dublin’s Cultural Quarter. I was delighted to learn that your request for a quiet room was honoured and that your check-in experience was “efficient, friendly and knowledgeable”. You are indeed correct in stating that the location is second to none: with all of Dublin’s best offerings a short walk from our front door eg. Trinity College, Dublin Castle and Grafton St – to name but a few.  In relation to booking with a 3rd party if you book directly next time (by phone or email) and mention “Tripadvisor” we can guarantee a 10% discount off prevailing rates with complimentary on-site parking. As previously stated I am currently in the process of upgrading the toiletries to the more traditional offering. I was glad that you enjoyed the new flat screen LED TV which we have installed into all 42 bedrooms – these should match the new compliment trays and guest directories in all of the bedrooms. I hope that you had an opportunity to try our continental breakfast offering @ €5.95 which includes an array of Italian hams, continental cheese and fresh fruits and cereals while cheekily checking out the competition. All in all I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for taking the time to communicate your feelings in relation to your expectations being met. I will personally endeavour to pass on your positive feedback to all of our team. Slan Leat, Kind Regards, David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Great location but not a good hotel
review: We spent three nights here and would give it a much better rating but the bottm line is that you go to hotel for sleep and our experience was that it was too noisey to get much.  The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to be helpful and as others have said, the location is terrific.  The room and beds were fine but there is no air conditioning so we had to leave the window open a bit as it was warm. Unfortunatly the noise outside was really loud from the bar patrons next door smoking outside and we were not there on a weekend.  One of the 3 nights was not too bad, but we left feeling exhausted from touring all day and not getting much sleep at night.  So, as I have said, if you are a partier and are up late, a very heavy sleeper or can be guaranteed a room away from…

title: Location great, but....
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent stay, here in the heart of Dublin’s Cultural Quarter. I was particularly pleased to learn of your appreciation of our “friendly staff who go out of their way” which, as you mentioned, is a consistent theme with guest feedback. Also your mention of our “terrific location” is something that guests continually comment on.  Being a city centre hotel we do occasionally experience on-street noise, upon your return I would gladly accommodate a request for a quieter room in the new wing , all of which have individual air-conditioning and temperature control. Please make sure to mention Tripadvisor to avail of a 10% discount when rebooking directly, either by phone or email. Thank you again. Kind Regards, David Cahill General Manager

title: Good location
review: A quite good hotel located just a few minutes walk from Temple Bar and other interesting areas. The room was actually bigger than we had expected for that price. The so called continental breakfast buffet was a bit of a disappointment though. There were however a lot of nice places nearby that served excellent breakfast.

title: Pleasant  stay at the Drury hotel
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent stay with us, here in the heart of Dublin city. I was pleased to learn of your appreciation of the central location and large room relative to the price. In an effort to remain competitive in the current climate we have reduced the Breakfast price to €5.95 for continental and €8.95 for a traditional cooked breakfast. I only hope that during  your experience you tried some of the array of fresh fruits, cereals, yoghurts, compotes and continental cheese and ham. Thank you again for your feedback and we look forward to welcoming back. Just a reminder to mention Tripadvisor to avail of a 10% discount or free parking when booking directly by phone or email. Kind Regards, David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Nice Hotel very close to Gaiety Theatre
review: My partner & I stayed in The Drury Court for one night last month, and had a nice pleasant experience, staff were approachable & knowledgeable, should we be staying in the city again this is certainly where it will be.

title: Location only thing going for it
review: Stayed here because our Son bought us tickets to a play in the Gaiety Theatre and it was a hotel close. Very good location in Dublin City Centre. Our room was a basic double room, had a comfortable bed, and very clean room. The woman on reception was very friendly. We ate lunch in the bar below the hotel the next morning, the food was very nice. I would go back.

title: "No Frills" BUT VERY Conveniently Located AND reasonable!
review: The location is good, however the hotel has the air of a budget hostel rather than a hotel. We did not enjoy our stay at all, in fact we spent quite a bit of time trying to find a nicer hotel but in the end decided to just make the best of a bad situation. Rooms are old and in need of refurbishment as is rest of the hotel. Our bathroom stank of sewage and when we asked to be moved to another room because of this they said they were fully booked - didn't seem that busy though. When we asked them to do something about the awful smell of sewage they just left us a can of air freshener! No attempt to actually rectify the problem and they really weren't interested.

title: Great Location
review: We stayed here for 2 nights last weekend. The location of the hotel is perfect,located rigth in the city centre and within walking distance of everything Dublin has to offer. The room was clean and comfortable. We had no trouble with noise or sleeping. The staff at reception were very helpful and directed us to everything we were looking for. The breakfast in Bia Bar was lovely and kept us going the whole day. The staff in the bar were very pleasant. If you are looking for somewhere to stay while visiting Dublin I would definately recommend this hotel. We will definately be back!

title: good value hotel in a great location
review: Just spent 2 nights at The Drury Court Hotel & had a fantastic stay. The staff were friendly and helpful which made our visit to Dublin all the more enjoyable. The reception were great on arrival, check out & throughout. We requested breakfast in our room quiet late the night before and the reception staff had no problem at all. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful. This hotel is good value & in a very central & convenient location. We found the room very adequate, it was spacious and the beds and linen were really comfortable. lovely bath and showers and lots of wardrobe space. Nice lively bar and again great staff. The hotel had a personality to it that a lot of others lack. The only thing i would suggest would be to provide fresh drinking water in the rooms but obviously its…

title: Very helpful staff.
review: We have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel.  We would like to personally thank Anne-Marie and the rest of the reception staff for their warm welcome and swift action in allocating a car space for our hire car which unfortunately had not been pre-booked by our travel company.  The hotel is centrally located and comfortable.  We would certainly stay here again if we return to Dublin.

title: Bare Bones,Convenient Location
review: This was my second stay in Dublin and was looking for a reasonably priced and conveniently located hotel. This hotel met those needs, but not much else. If you are only concerned about those things and don't require much in the way of creature comforts that are so common these days this is the perfect place for you. If you do however require reliable Internet, a shower that does more than spit at you, and a bathroom door that actually closes you may want to look elsewhere. The room and bathroom were very clean, however the towels are thin and scratchy. The old box style tv didn't get any channels, and despite being on a higher floor the noise throughout the night on the weekend woke me up. The front desk staff were friendly, and the Bia Bar downstairs is convenient, but I will…

title: Loved this hotel!!
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience, here in the heart of Dublin city. I was pleased to learn of your appreciation for our central location clean bedroom and bathroom and friendly staff. I was disappointed to learn of your WIFI experience, especially given that I personally use it on my laptop during working hours, which I assure you is at present fully operational.  Being in the heart of Dublin city, the city itself can be a little lively and I hope this did not detract too much from your stay. I also have pleasure in announcing that we have new LCD  TV’s for all the bedrooms which should be with us soon.  Thank you again for your custom and your comments. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Lovely Hotel and Friendly Staff
review: My Husband, Myself and our 5 year old daughter stayed for 2 nights at the Drury Court Hotel in August 2012. We stayed in a lovely room at the back of the hotel, which was nice and quiet, Breakfast each morning was delicious. We have the Full Irish, and we would recommend this. All cooked to perfection. My Daughter loved the crossiants. The staff are very friendly and helpful. In the evening time we went to the bar for dinner, My daughter was given some home made cookies. Which she adored. The location is great. So near all the shops. We were also welcomed by David the hotel manager, he suggested a few places to see. Like the Doll's Hospital in PowersCourt shopping Center. My daughter had a ball there, She was fascinated with all the dolls and accessories. I would highly…

title: Adequate but not amazing
review: I stayed at the Drury Court Hotel for one night in July 2012.I  needed a place for one night only as I was to catch a tour to the west coast the following morning.   I did have a considerable struggle to locate the hotel. Arriving at Dublin's airport and connecting to the downtown by airport bus, I found myself dropped off a few blocks away from the hotel. However, no one I asked (including the bus driver and someone at a tourist info booth) could give me clear directions to Lower Stephens street. Very frustrating. My room  was okay...nothing special. The hotel's lobby is very small and understated. However, I was pleased with the bar and restaurant . I ate my breakfast there and it was very nice.When asked for a place for dinner , the front desk staff recommended the bar…

title: Great Location but rooms are inconsistent.
review: We stayed at the Drury Court in July, 2012.  I had  booked a twin room and requested a quiet floor after reading recent reviews about the noise on the corner units/ street side.  We were given a room on the 4th floor which faced the hotel next door, you could see directly into the rooms across.  There was a tiny laneway between the two hotels that was very busy with traffic coming from Great George Street behind the hotel.  There was no A/C in these rooms and it was very warm up there.  Only 2 small windows opened but the traffic and noise in the laneway from delivery trucks, garage removal could be heard day and night.  Also you had to close the drapes to get privacy but they were very heavy so no air could get in while they were closed and it made the dreary dull room worse. …

title: Handy to Everything
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to make us aware of your recent experience, here in the heart of Dublin city. I was pleased to learn of your appreciation for our crisp white bed linen and central location. I  personally dealt with you during your room move and it was my understanding that your move was exclusively motivated by the fact that your original room did not have air conditioning. I am surprised that, given the gravity of your comments in relation to the room,  you did not bring them to my attention at this particular point or indeed at any, during your stay. Specifically in relation to the kettles I am at a loss to understand this, especially given the fact that I have only just replaced the kettle in every bedroom.  I  only hope that your  remarks  were not motivated by our check-in / cancellation policy which is either credit card authorisation or prepayment by cash on arrival (with a 24hr cancellation period there-after). We take all comments by our guests seriously, both positive and constructive, which is why I will endeavour to contact you personally to take the matter further. Thank you again for your comments. Kind Regards,  David Cahill. General Manager.

title: Pleasant place to stay
review: Our room was quite comfortable if a little "tired", with adequate facilities. TV reception was quite poor and there was only one bedside lamp. Breakfast was delicious in the comfortable setting of the bar where we also had drinks and a meal one night. The staff in the bar were very friendly and helpful. It is very handy to all the major tourist sights in Dublin but we would probably try other hotels in the area if we were in Dublin again.
